Ali is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and four siblings. In 2010, in order to supplement the family’s income, he decided to start his own work as a farmer. His father is the main income provider, but his income is not enough to cover their heavy life costs. Ali works independently; his job consists in cultivating seasonal fruit. He knows very well how to take care of the trees, especially from one season to another. 

Today, he is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase required agricultural tools and supplies, a new electric saw and many other items. He states that the loan will certainly help him increase his business productivity by a fair percentage which will give him higher profits. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase required agricultural tools and supplies, a new electric saw and many other items

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. Like every couple, Kassem and his wife wish to have their own family and children. For this reason, they combine forces to be able live a suitable life, far from problems and complications. 

Kassem opened his own butchery in 2002. He’s a reputable person who always seeks to deliver good, fresh products to his customers. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new tools and equipment for his butchery. Then he will be capable to develop his business and augment his sales. In the future, he plans to raise cattle and start his own dairy products business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for his butchery

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is 44 years old and a resident of Lebanon. He is married to Sabah, the mother of his five children, who are all attending school. Hussein supports his family with pleasure and is ready to help whenever they need it. He has an adorable family, for whom he’s ready to sacrifice his life. 

Hussein has owned a van for the past six years. His job consists of transporting students to their schools. He works independently on a freelance basis. In parallel, he works as a farmer. Today, he’s in need of a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the necessary maintenance on his van. This loan will allow him to perform his job properly. The most important thing is transporting the students safely without facing any problems. Hussein has many ideas for the future to improve his business, and he’s planning to apply these ideas once he has the opportunity.

loans.use: to perform the necessary maintenance on his van

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges is a 30-year-old Lebanese engaged man. He lives with his parents and two working siblings. His father is the main source of income and he really cares for their future. Since Georges wishes to get married and, at the same time, help his father with the expenses, he decided to start his own business. He opened his own discotheque in 2009. He diversifies his items in order to please his clients. He also attends some events where he plays a musical instrument. This will be an added source of income for him and his family. Today he intends to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase music CD’s and DVD’s in order to increase the number of products and therefore earn a higher income. In the future, he plans to open a small cinema in his town where he can receive customers from his town and the surroundings.

loans.use: to purchase music CD’s and DVD’s

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 48-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. Two of her children attend school and one working. In 2002, she started running her own business selling accessories and Brazilian gold. Her income is really essential to help her husband with the household expenses and to pay her children’s school fees. Her husband works in security in a local company and they cooperate together to meet the needs of life. Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her inventory of accessories and gold. Her intention at this stage is to augment her sales to amplify her income. In the future, she is planning to open her own shop and diversify her items even more.

loans.use: to expand her inventory of accessories and gold

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kyakimwa  est entrepreneur, doyenne du groupe d’affaire « Neema »,  âgée de plus de 50 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants dont certains étudient et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers. Son mari est un cadre d’une entreprise publique douanière « l’Office Congolais de Contrôle (OCC) ». La cliente  est vendeuse  de boissons (Primus, Aigles, Fanta, etc.).  Il ya 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, en 2005, elle bénéficia le premier crédit de Hekima, actuellement, elle a réalisé 21 cycles de crédit. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter 10 casiers de Primus, 10 casiers Aigles et  5 casiers de Fanta.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison dans sa propre parcelle.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en: The client, Kyakimwa is an entrepreneur, the head of the business group "Neema", older than 50, married, and the mother of four children some of whom are students and others have their own homes. Her husband is a manager of a public customs business "l’Office Congolais de Contrôle (OCC)". The client is a drink seller (Primus, Aigles, Fanta, etc.).  She has been doing this for more than 10 years. In 2005, she received her first loan from Hekima, she has gone through 21 credit cycles. This new line of credit will be used to buy 10 cases of Primus, 10 cases of Aigles, and 5 cases of Fanta.  She hopes to send her children to school and build a house on her own land. The client thanks Hekima for their support of poor, unbanked women.

loans.use: to buy 10 cases of Primus, 10 cases of Aigles, and 5 cases of Fanta

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is 26 years old. He lives in the Khulo District with his wife, father and 3-year-old daughter. 

Zviad requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The source of income for the family is the monthly salary of Zviad, who works locally as a school watchman. Besides, the family grows potatoes on the family-owned agricultural land and sells the harvested products locally. 

According to the government’s estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and gets a relevant pension from the local government.  The monthly income of the family is 300 Laris. It is hardly enough to feed a four-member family. 

Zviad requested a loan from Credo to start up a dairy farm. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country’s rural poor. The rural poor do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Zviad will purchase two milk cows. He will place them in an old empty farm building located in their yard. Zviad will work hard on the farm. He will produce dairy products and sell them in the village. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows and start up a dairy farm.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en: Tamaz is 31 years old. He lives with his parents in Sighnaghi District, Kakheti region, East Georgia. His parents are provided with a retirement pension. The family owns a vineyard and produces wine to sell locally. Additionally, he owns a hectare of agricultural land which needs cultivating, however, the income is not enough for covering the everyday expenses. So, Tamaz decided to start up a new business. He has requested loans from his local financial institutions several times without any success. His loan requests were rejected every time because of low income and a lack of experience in the new job, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. His loan request was approved under a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program provides startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions for rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the loan, Tamaz will cultivate a hectare agricultural land and sow cucumbers and peppers which will increase his income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. Tamaz awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate a hectare of land to grow cucumbers and peppers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings. With the cooperation of his father, Ali was able to respond to his family needs so they can live a respectable life. 

Ali has owned a mini-market for several years. He has a big variety of products which he sells to customers from his town and the neighboring villages. He’s well known for being kind and friendly with his customers even when they are visiting his shop for the first time. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the required quantity of food provisions for his mini-market. Then he will be able to diversify his inventory and therefore increase his revenue and improve his family’s way of living. 

Ali looks forward to expanding his grocery and collecting the needed savings to be able to get married and have his own family and children.

loans.use: to purchase the required quantity of food provisions for his mini-market

loans.name: Marriam

texts.en:
Ms Marriam is a 56-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last three years. She faced a lot of hurdles in her married life as her husband is employed in a small factory of manufacturing. It was getting hard for him to bear everyday expenditures of family members alone. Such circumstances compelled Nasreen to initiate business activity to support her family. She is a mother of four. She is putting a lot of effort in contributing family income to provide her children with the basic necessities of life. Her husband is very supportive and assists her by buying stock of goods from the market.

She needs goods of daily use to meet her customers demand time after time. For this she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy stock of rice, flour and grains. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She hopes to get increase in her income by catering more customers. She wishes to utilize the part of profits on providing quality education to her children and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, flour and grains.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is married and lives with her husband and their children. She has a store where she sells basic necessities such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other items. Mupa has been in business for many years and has gained sales experience that allows her to generate more income. Her store is in her home, which is situated in a very busy location. She has many customers who prefer to do business with her because she has quality products at affordable prices and always makes customers her priority. The secret behind her success is her consistency and her love for her work. She knows this is the only way to achieve what she wants.

Like any good merchant, she wants to increase her business by making a new investment. Mupa is in need of capital, so she is requesting a loan from Yehu Microfinance to buy basic grains, snack foods, eggs, bread, beverages, and other products. She has good credit references and is confident that she can repay this loan while providing her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in a grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Saeedan

texts.en:
Ms. Saeedan is a 33-year old married woman. She is very motivated and has always wanted to do something to help improve her family situation. 
Her husband, a driver, had been the sole earner of the family, and it had been difficult to cover all household expenses from his income alone, so Saeedan took initiative and started a clothes retailing business. She purchases clothes in various designs and colors from the market at wholesale prices to sell to people in her community. She knows the tastes of her customers very well.

She is a mother of five, four of whom are attending school currently. She needs to improve her business, so she can use profits to meet the needs of her children. In order to purchase more variety of winter season clothes, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20000. With the new merchandise, she will able to earn increased profits through her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of winter season clothes

loans.name: Manyazi

texts.en:
A reseller of ready-to-wear outfits and shoes since 2009, Manyazi also farms seasonally. She is married, and the mother of two.  Both children are in   school. 

She manages her own business, but does not yet have a fixed location. She is requesting her fourth loan from Yehu Microfinance to buy merchandise. 

She wants to save her profits, and expand her business to better cover the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and outfits to resell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty earns a living by selling vegetables and fruits and cooked food to people from her place in Kisauni, Mombasa. She has been in the business for more than ten years now.

Betty is asking for a loan to buy cooking ingredients like vegetables, meat, seasoning, cooking oil and others. With the ingredients funded by this loan she will be able to cook more food to sell.

In the future, Betty hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like vegetables, meat, seasoning, cooking oil and others.

loans.name: Sénam

texts.fr: Célibataire sans enfant âgée de 26 ans, Sénam est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique de la place. Elle a débuté en 2009 et sollicite son premier prêt auprès de WAGES pour se ravitailler en produits alimentaires. Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices supplémentaires pour acheter un terrain ensuite. Elle souhaite agrandir d’avantage son activité et de préparer déjà la venue de ses futurs enfants.
texts.en: Single and with no children at 26 years old, Sénam is a retailer of general foodstuffs in a shop on the square. She began in 2009 and is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to re-stock her supply of foodstuffs. She wants to save her supplementary profits in order to later purchase land. Sénam wishes to further expand her business and to begin to prepare for the arrival of her future children.

loans.use: To purchase general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 36-year-old married man with 4 children living in Kyenjojo,Uganda.  He has been in the motorcycle and bicycle spare parts business for four years. He has a tea plantation, and also trades in produce for additional income. 

His business is located along a busy street where clients can easily find him.  After realizing that his family was growing and he needed to give them a better standard of living, he decided to venture in a number of businesses as noted above.

Charles is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle and bicycle parts to resell.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is requesting a new loan because she needs to buy more stock for her fruit and vegetable selling business. She will buy apples, pears, grapes, potatoes, tomatoes, and other fruits that are in demand to continue selling to her customers.

Yehu financial support has had positive effect as it allowed her to keep her business going. With her earnings, she has been able to contribute towards her family's daily food costs. She will continue her sales, and she will also continue supporting her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy apples, pears, grapes, potatoes, tomatoes, and other fruits to increase her stock for her business.

loans.name: Beglar

texts.en: Beglar is from the Keda district of West Georgia. He is fifty years old, and lives with his three children and daughter-in-law. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. More specifically, the family owns a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables and fruits are grown. Additionally, they have a cow whose milk is used in cheese production. Beglar and his family do all of the relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are then sold at the local open market. Beglar is a very hard-working man with a lot of experience in this work. Beglar has requested a loan to purchase beehives with bee colonies. This will enable him to produce ecologically clean honey that he can then sell at the local open market. This investment will increase his family's income. With increased income they will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beehives with bee colonies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a fruit vendor, a business she has been running for over six years. In this business, she sells mangoes, oranges, lemon, melon etc. She is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to buy new stock of fruits. The main challenge she faces is the shortage of stock and the high taxation from government agencies. 

She is a mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She has a plan to educate her children from the additional income that she will obtain from this loan.

loans.use: To buy new stock of fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Mndalu

texts.en:
Mndalu is one of the best in his trade. His self-discipline and dedication has taught him that dreams can come true and that no barriers exist apart from those that we limit ourselves with.

His biggest wish is to be able to improve the service in his business and earn some income. Because of this he is asking for a loan so that he can establish a cell phone charging business. With the loan, he wants to purchase battery and cell phone charger for use in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a battery and cell phone charger for use in his business.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a married mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She is a fishmonger, and has run her business for one year. Besides this, she also owns a tailoring and a charcoal selling business. Jackline was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit for business operations. She is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to revamp her tailoring business by buying sewing threads, needles and materials for dress making in preparation for the festive season. She believes the extra income from this business will help her provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy sewing threads, needles and materials for dress making

loans.name: Alim

texts.en: Alim is 36 years old. He is married and has three children. Alim lives in the Fizuli region of Azerbaijan with his wife and children, but he was an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli the town. Now he needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy calves to improve his business. He loves his work. Alim has been in the agriculture business for two years. He breeds cows.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Ngongo

texts.en:
Ngongo is married and the father of two children, who are still too young for school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a trader who sells broiler chickens. With the current loan, he intends to purchase chicks, vitamins, feed and vaccines in order to increase his stock.

In the future, he wishes to start a new business in order to increase his monthly income. For that reason, he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled so that he can request more loans from Yehu Microfinance.

The challenge he faces is having funds that help him to expand his chicken raising business and to buy other types of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, vitamins, feed and vaccines in order to increase his stock.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en: Manana is 42 years old. She lives in the Gurjaani District, East Georgia with her brother and parents, who are provided with a retirement pension.  The family has a vineyard and sells grapes locally at a good price. She has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was always rejected, due to lack of experience in a new business. Experience is usually demanded by local credit providers. Manana requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved under a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions providing business start-up and re-startup credits with easier conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Manana will purchase used clothing and sell it from her house among her neighbors. She will begin her entrepreneurial activity with a wide assortment of merchandise and high sales volume. This will increase the family's income. She wants to develop her business further and reinvest the increased income in trading. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. She is grateful in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing and resell it

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 05 Décembre  2000 à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il compte 26 femmes très dynamiques, elles  vivent dans le même village et sont dans le programme des bancs villageois depuis plus une décennie. Elles ont  comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata (debout à l’extrême droite avec une la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 garçons et une fille. Elle tient une gargote au village où elle sert le petit déjeuner. Activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de cinq ans. 

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter du sucre 20 000 FCFA le sac, du café 4 pots de 2 500 FCFA l’un et du lait en quantité suffisante pour assurer la continuité de son activité sans rupture pour une durée d’un mois.

Les bénéfices réalises lui permettent d’augmenter son épargne et d’accroitre son niveau de vie assurer la scolarité des enfants et leur besoin médical.
texts.en:
The group was created December 5th, 2000 with the inauguration of their banc villageois. The group is made up of 26 dynamic women. They live in the same village and have been in the banc villageois for over a decade. Their main business activity is small-scale commerce.

Fatoumata (standing on the far right with her hand raised,) is the featured borrrower. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three sons and one daughter. She owns a breakfast eatery in the village and has had the business for more than five years. 

With this new loan, she would like to buy sugar (20,000 FCFA a bag,) four bags of coffee (2,500 FCFA each,) and enough milk to ensure the business can continue without interruption for one month. 

With the profits from this loan, she will be able to increase her savings and improve her standard of living, educate her children, and ensure their medical needs are met.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, and enough milk to ensure the business can continue without interruption for one month.

loans.name: Aimons Nous Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATI représente le groupe AIMONS NOUS. Marié, elle est mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 04 vont à l’école et elle à 07 personnes à sa charge.
Mme vend des galettes et des noix de kola depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les femmes, hommes.
Mme veut s’acheter 01sac de petit mil pour préparer ses galettes et 01 calebasse de noix de kola.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut  améliorer son activité. Mme ambitionne épargner et aider son mari pour les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Fati represents the group Aimons Nous. Married, she is the mother of 6 children. The oldest is 17 years old and the youngest is 2 years old. Four go to school and she has 7 dependents. Fati has been selling cakes and kola nuts for 3 years. She gets her supplies at the market in her neighborhood. Her customers are women and men. Fati wants to buy herself 1 bag of small mil [African cereal] to prepare her cakes and 1 gourd of kola nuts. With her profits, she wants to improve her business. Fati has the ambition of saving and helping her husband with the family responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy herself 1 bag of small mil [African cereal] to prepare her cakes and 1 gourd of kola nuts.

loans.name: Sanounou

texts.fr: Âgé de 28 ans, Sanounou est marié et père d’un  enfant de 03 ans. Il  pratique  la revente des produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2006. Il dispose d’une boutique qu’il gère seul grâce à son dynamisme et son habilité dans les affaires. Il  désire accroitre son rendement et pour cela elle sollicite son second crédit auprès de WAGES pour acheter de la marchandise. Il  veut ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et s’occuper de l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Twenty-eight years old, Sanounou is married and the father of one 3-year-old child. He has been reselling general foodstuffs since 2006. He owns a store which he manages alone thanks to his dynamism and his aptitude for business. He wants to grow his returns and for this he is requesting his second loan from WAGES to buy merchandise. Thus he wants to improve the living conditions of his family and take care of the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Yelmani Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTOU représente le groupe YELMANI. Marié, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 16ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle à 04 personnes à sa charge.
Mme vend des fruits et pommes depuis 03ans. Elle vient de commencer la vente du petit mil. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les revendeurs femmes à bobo.
Mme veut s’acheter 80 assiettes (yoruba) de petit mil pour stocker et revendre en période de soudure.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut  épargner. Mme ambitionne augmenter son commerce et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Bintou is part of the Yelmani group.  Married, she is the mother of three children, the oldest is 21 years old, and the youngest is 16 year old.  She has just started selling millet.  She gets her supplies from her neighborhood market.  Her customers are female retailers in her neighborhood.  She would like to buy 80 plates of millet to stock up and sell in the lean period.  With her profits, she hopes to increase her sales and support her husband with the family duties.

loans.use: s’acheter 80 assiettes (yoruba) de petit mil pour stocker et revendre en période de soudure.

loans.name: Jhoana Sarai

texts.es:
Jhoana, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 22 años de edad, vive con sus padres en casa propia, realiza el negocio de la venta de ropa para ayudar a sus padres a mantener el hogar, tiene 7 años de experiencia, dicho negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, realiza la venta en el mercado de la ciudad ofreciendo además gorras y carteras.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de blusas, calzonetas, short, entre otras prendas necesarias, esto le ayudara para que su negocio este más surtido y pueda atender la clientela, mejorando sus ingresos para su familia.
La aspiración de Jhoana es fortalecer el negocio, aumentando la capacidad para atender la demanda, permitiéndole salir de la pobreza con su familia.
texts.en:
Jhoana sells clothes. She is 22 years old and lives with her parents in their home. She has her business selling clothes to help her parents with household expenses. She has seven years' experience. This business began through Jhoana's own initiative. She makes sales in the city's marketplaces, and she also sells hats and purses.

She is requesting a loan to purchase blouses, women's underwear, shorts, and other necessary items. This will help her stock her business more and better serve her customers, improving the income for her family.

Johana's goal is to strengthen her business, growing her capacity to meet demand, and allowing her to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: purchase blouses, women's underwear, and shorts.

loans.name: Mykhamadi

texts.ru: Мухамади – 34 года, женат, имеет 2 детей. Работает в автомойке мойщиком и одновременно является сторожем данной автомойки. Опыт работы в этой сфере деятельности более 3 лет. Кредитуется в нашей организации с 2010 года. Мухамади является постоянным, пунктуальным, порядочным клиентом нашей организации. Он ни разу не нарушил условия кредитования. В связи с наступающими холодами на полученный кредит Мухамади хочет отремонтировать крышу дома. Супруга Мухаммади – домохозяйка, занимается шитьем национальной одежды. Она всячески поддерживает своего супруга. Мухаммади благодарен нашей организации за финансовую помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Muhamadi is 34 years old, married and has two children. He works as a guard and a car washer at a car wash. He has more than 3 years of working experience in this field. Muhamadi has been a punctual, honest client of Arvand since 2010. He has never violated any terms of his loans. In light of the upcoming cold weather, Muhamadi wants to use the loan to repair the roof of his house. His wife, who sews traditional clothing at home, supports him as much as possible. Muhamadi thanks Arvand for financial assistance and support.

loans.use: Purchase building materials for roof repairs at home

loans.name: La Loma Ahorros (Flat) Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Loma Ahorros” es un grupo ubicado en una comunidad muy pequeña y lleva este nombre porque donde se reúne el grupo hay una colina desde donde se puede apreciar un lindo paisaje. Los integrantes del grupo son tres mujeres y tres hombres y son muy talentosas en sus negocios. Margarita, quien es la representante, tiene 31 años de edad, es una mujer casada desde hace seis años con el señor Juan y juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos de los cuales dos se encuentran estudiando. Mago, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la crianza y engorda de borregos desde hace 6 años y platica que inició su actividad porque fue su iniciativa de querer ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos, esta vez solicita el crédito para comprar 2 borregos y pastura suficiente para sus otras 10 borregas que tiene en casa. Mago cuenta que desde que inicio con la crianza de sus borregos no ha tenido grandes dificultades solo cuando llegan a enfermarse pero de inmediato los lleva con el veterinario y se recuperan sin grandes dificultades. Mago comentó “Mi meta es terminar de construir mi casa para que mis hijos tengan un hogar digno, pero también me encantaría que ellos terminaran una carrera profesional para que puedan tener una vida estable sin tantos conflictos económicos”. Así como Mago se dedica a la crianza de borregos para tener un ingreso mas también los demás integrantes del grupo como por ejemplo René y Roberto invertirán en sus tiendas de abarrotes, Carmen comprara un borrego para cría y venta, Noemí comprara becerros para cría y venta. Finalmente, Fidel comprara plantas para su venta. En general, el grupo tiene varios ciclos trabajando con la institución lo que les ha permitido  tener éxito en sus negocios y sobretodo darle lo necesario a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “La Loma Ahorros” (The Savings Knoll) is located in a very small community and has this name because the group meets in an area that has a hill where they can appreciate the pretty countryside. The group is made up of three women and three men who are very good at running their businesses. Margarita, who is the group representative, is 31 years old and has been married to Juan for six years. Together they have three children, two of whom are currently in school. Mago, as she is known by her friends, works raising and fattening sheep, which she has done for six years.  She started her business of her own initiative because she wanted to help her husband with their household expenses and their children's education. She is asking for a loan to buy two sheep and sufficient grass to feed her ten other sheep. Since the beginning of her business she has not had any difficulties, except for when the sheep get sick. But when this happens she immediately takes them to the veterinarian and they recover easily. Mago says "my goal is to finish building my house so that my children can have a dignified home, but I would also love for them to have successful careers and stable lives without economic struggles." For this reason Mago works raising sheep to add one more income to the family. 

Group members René and Roberto will invest their loans in their grocery stores. Carmen will buy a sheep to raise and sell. Noemí will buy calves to rasie and sell. Finally, Fidel will by plants to sell. The group has taken out many loans with the institution that have enabled them to be successful in their businesses and above all give the necessary to their families.

loans.use: to buy sheep and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase coffee plants and prepare her land for planting

loans.name: Blanca Elba

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella inicio es negocio con el objetivo de tener una fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, su horario de venta es de 6:00am hasta las 2:00pm.
Ella necesita el apoyo financiero para invertir en el negocio, comprando materiales como quesillo, aceite, chicharrón, condimentos, este préstamo le será muy útil pues no tiene actualmente la capacidad que desea en el negocio.
Su aspiración es mejorar el negocio, del cual  provea a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca sells tortillas and pupusas [a typical food of El Salvador]. She lives with her husband and two children. She began this business with the goal of having a source of income to help her husband with the household expenses. Her sales hours are from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm.

She needs financial support to invest in the business, buying materials such as soft cheese, oil, cracklings, and condiments. This loan will be very useful, since now she doesn't have the capacity that she would like in her business.

Her goal is to improve her business and from it provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft cheese, oil, cracklings, and condiments

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y su esposo tiene 52 años, tienen dos hijos de 18 y 22 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos, en una zona muy asediada por clientes, aprendió con sus padres y trabaja todos los días de lunes a viernes. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de pescado, camarones frescos, tambien invertirá en la compra de verduras frescas para mejorar el negocio, incrementando el producto fresco.
Su aspiración es Fortalecer el negocio, a través de la ayuda de los créditos, ofrecer una mejor vida y economía a su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is 47 years old. She is married, and her husband is 52. They have two children, ages 18 and 22. She sells seafood is a zone with a lot of shoppers. She learned [this business] from her parents, and she works every day from Monday to Friday.

She is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of fish and fresh shrimp, and she will also invest in the purchase of fresh vegetables to improve her business, increasing her fresh products.

Her goal is to strengthen her business through the help of the loans and to offer a better life and financial situation to her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, fresh shrimp, and fresh vegetables

loans.name: Señor De Puquin Group

texts.es:
Julia tiene 41 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la provincia de Anta. Su actividad económica principal de Julia es la venta de ropa como camisas, pantalones, chompas y otras cosas más. Julia hace varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Julia una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de eta manera que ella saca adelante a su familia. Julia requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como ropa para niños, caballeros y damas. Julia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas. (Julia está levantando la mano en la fotografía).  

Los otros socios se dedican a la renovar zapatos, brindar servicio de taxi, venta de comida, venta de artesanía y venta de verduras. 

Todos se encuentran feliz por el apoyo y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Julia is 41 years old and is in a relationship that has produced two children. She was born in the province of Anta, Peru. She makes a living selling clothes, such as shirts, pants, sweaters and other items. She has done this job for a number of years and it is going very well. Julia is a responsible and hardworking person who has made headway for her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase more supplies, like clothes for men, women and children. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time. Julia is the one raising her hand in the photograph. The other members make a living working on shoes, providing taxi service, selling food, selling arts and crafts and selling vegetables. All of the members are happy about the support and promise to make their payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for men, women and children.

loans.name: Barrio El Riito Group

texts.es: El grupo "Barrio el Riito" esta conformado por mujeres las cuales son muy trabajadoras y responsables es la primera vez que estan en el grupo y trabajando con la institución, el nombre del grupo lo han elegido porque se encuentran cerca de un río pequeño que tiene agua cristalina agua que la comunidad aprovecha para beber. Doña Luisa es una mujer muy trabajadora es una mujer de 41 años de edad, está casada con el señor Jose y juntos han formado una familia con cinco niños que asisten a la escuela, Doña Luisa es la representante del grupo  lleva trabajando con la institución tres ciclos en los que ha solicitado el crédito para comprar mas borregos esta vez no sabe cuantos va a comprar porque también tendrá que comprar pastura para los mismos, ya que platica que aunque saca a pastarlos por las tardes a veces no es suficiente. Doña Luisa desde hace 6 años tienen experiencia con la crianza de los borregos para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que para Doña Luisa es muy importante que sus hijos estudien y se realicen profesionalmente por lo que paltica que esa es su meta lograr que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida, aunque su dificultad de Doña Luisa es la falta de dinero para arreglar el corral de sus borregos para que no enfermen con frecuencia porque si los borregos de Doña Luisa enferman pueden llegar a morir lo que representaría en Doña Luisa es una pérdida de ganancia. Aunque Doña Luisa esta muy contentas por el préstamo otorgado por la institución al igual que los otros integrantes del grupo como Doña Juana, Guadalupe, Teresa y Elodia podrán comprar mas pollos, mientras que Doña Pilar, Tomasa y Antonia están solicitando el crédito para comprar mas borregos y finalmente Doña Herlinda podrá abastecer su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The "Barrio el Riito" Group is made up of very responsible and hard-working women. It is the first time they're in this group and working with the institution (VisionFund Mexico), and they have chosen their group name because they are located close to a small river with crystal clear water that the community drinks from. 

Doña Luisa is a very hard-working 41-year-old woman who is married to José; together they have formed a family with five children who are in school. Doña Luisa is her group representative and has been working with the institution for three loan cycles, in which she has requested loans to buy more sheep. This time, she is not sure how many sheep she will buy because she also needs to buy their feed, since even though she lets them graze in the afternoons sometimes that's not enough. She has been raising sheep for the last six years so that she can help out with household expenses, since for Doña Luisa it is very important for her children to study and become professionally accomplished; her goal is for her children to have a better quality of life. Doña Luisa's challenge is that she lacks money to fix her sheep pen so that they don't get sick very often, since if they get sick they could die and that would mean a loss of income. Doña Luisa is very happy with the loan she received from the institution, just like the other group members: Doña Juana, Guadalupe, Eteresa and Elodia will buy more chickens, while Doña Pilar, Tomasa and Antonia are requesting their loans to buy more sheep, and Doña Herlinda will restock her small grocery store. 
.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, bread, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling scrap gold. Lucia is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF (Kiva's field partner in the region) to purchase more items like pants, t-shirts, caps and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities with support from her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pants, t-shirts, caps and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Juan Grabiel

texts.es:
Juan originario de Boaco, con 31 años de edad, acompañado, padre de 1 hijos de 3 meses, de oficio comerciante. Inicio trabajando como ayudante de su papa en la elaboración de zapatos, pero a la edad de 23 años, decidió independizarse con su propio negocio, del que es propietario hace más de 8 años. Su esposa lo ayuda administrar el negocio. Sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio para atraer mas clientes y asi obtener mejores ingresos, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Juan solicita el préstamo para comprar mas insumo como cuero, suela, pegamento y clavo para  la elaboración de sus zapatos. Ya que sus objetivos es incrementar sus ventas al tener más variedad de zapato sobre todo porque se acerca la época navideña donde  las ventas son muy buenas para el sector comercio. Espera mejorar sus ingresos  y  surtir el negocio con nueva mercadería de nuevos estilos de zapatos y sandalias. Su anhelo es lograr una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is originally from Boaco.  He’s 31 years old, married, and has a three month old son.  [Juan] is a merchant by trade.  He began working, helping his father make shoes, but when he was 23 he decided to venture out on his own and start his own business, which he has had for more than 8 years.  His wife helps him manage the business.  He wants to expand and attract more customers so that he can have a better income and improve his family’s living conditions.

Juan is asking for a loan so that he can buy supplies such as soles, glue, and nails for making shoes.  He wants to have a greater variety around because the Christmas season is approaching and his sales are very good then.  He hopes to increase his income, stock his business with new styles of shoes and sandals.  His desire is to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is 30 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by buying and selling pigs in the Philippines, a business she has been doing for four years. She earns additional income by farming corn and peanuts. Marifel is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF (Kiva's field partner) to purchase additional pigs and other livestock to sell.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business so she can build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and other livestock to sell

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 31-year-old, married man who lives with his wife and one school-aged child. He is a hard worker looking to offer his family a suitable and appropriate life. Nidal is a furniture painter who works with a high degree of professionalism. He has many years of experience in this job. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best results he can. He’s well known in his area and has loyal customers who trust the good quality of his work.

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to refurbish his painting tools. He will utilize the loan to facilitate his work and have a good start to his new project. Nidal is grateful for all the good things god has given him. In the near future, he hopes to take on more projects, possibly outside the country if this will help him learn new designs and better develop his business.

loans.use: to refurbish his painting tools

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells smoked fish in Akatakyiwa. Aba has never been educated. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a carpenter. Aba has been selling smoked fish for 20 years. She is responsible for supporting her husband in taking care of their children. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants dont 01 scolarisé, Akoko est mariée et est âgée de 34 ans. Son premier enfant a 05 ans et le dernier a 03 ans. Elle assure la distribution en détail des produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2010 grâce à sa boutique. Son activité étant à cours de fonds de roulement, elle sollicite son premier prêt auprès de WAGES pour investir dans son  commerce. Son profit sera destiné à l’épargne. Elle désire associer le commerce de tissus pagnes d’ici peu et mieux assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: A mother of two children, of whom one is in school, Akoko is married and 34 years old. Her first child is 5 years old, and the last is 3. Akoko has been ensuring the retail distribution of grocery items in her store since 2010. Her business being short of working capital, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to invest in her business. Her profits will go toward savings. She would like to include commerce in 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in the near future and to do better in ensuring her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Vache

texts.en:
Vache is 23 years old and was born and lives in Antaramut, which is the one of the Vanadzor’s area villages. He is married and lives with his wife, newborn son and parents. Vache graduated from Vanadzor’s collage; he is a dental technician and has never worked in his main profession, because his profession is less profitable in Vanadzor and he must meet his newly-created family's needs. Therefore he decided to create his own charcoal production business.

The production activity he is performing is in Antaramut. Vache buys the wood for his charcoal production from their village woodmen. With big special ovens, he handles the thermal treatment. As a result, he produces charcoal. Vache’s father helps him in the family business and with their own truck delivers charcoal to Lori region’s restaurants and grill houses.

With profit from his business, Vache has bought a truck and furniture for their house. He solves his small family's needs and takes care for his baby’s future.

Vache seeks 400.000 AMD loan to buy two new ovens for developing his charcoal production. He hopes to increase his profit this way.

loans.use: To buy two new ovens for developing his charcoal production

loans.name: Nyae

texts.en:
Nyae is a married man who has no child. Nyae has been breeding goats for last 5 years. 

Nyae usually buys small goats, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Tiribe and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. 

He wants to expand his business and improve life conditions of his family. He applied for a loan to purchase two goats for resale. This will be his second loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase 2 goats

loans.name: Gude

texts.en:
Gude lives in the town of Tiribe in the Mombasa region of Kenya. He is married and has two children, who are still in school. For the past three years, Gude has been working hard to manage his hardware store, which sells cement and bricks.

To help expand his business, Gude has requested a loan from Yehu Microfinance. The loan will be used to add on capital and buy more hardware items such as cement and bricks, and will help Gude to generate greater profits and expand his business into a big hardware shop. 

Gude hopes that in the future he will be able to start another hardware store.

loans.use: to purchase items such as cement and bricks.

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koulikoro de Koutiala qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les pagnes, les médicaments traditionnels, les parfums, les tasses, de la viande, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. 
Aminata est un membre du groupe Benkadi, arrêtée aux milieux, qui fait l’achat vente de pagnes.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter dix pièces de pagnes wax. Elle se procure de ses pagnes  au grand marché  de Koutiala. Elle vend ses articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 118 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Aminata  compte réaliser 140 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of women from the Koulikoro district of Koutiala who live in large traditional extended families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. The women average 33 years of age, are married, and average four children each. This group of women does commerce in a variety of goods, such as 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), traditional medicines, perfumes, basins, meat, etc. 

To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are now on their fifth group loan. 

Aminata is a member of the group Benkadi. She is standing in the middle of the photo, and she buys and sells 'pagne' cloth. She intends to use her loan to purchase 10 lengths of Wax 'pagne' cloth. She gets her supplies from the big market of Koutiala. She sells her goods retail for cash to a diverse customer base at the house and at the market. 

While the other group members of Benkadi each plan on making an average profit of 118,000 francs CFA over the course of this cycle, Aminata plans on making 140,000 francs.

In addition to repaying the loans, the women use part of the revenues to cope with personnel expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to purch 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa)

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouma est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les médicaments traditionnels, les condiments, et bien d’autres articles divers. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe. 
Mari  est un membre du groupe Sabougnouma deuxième personne de gauche à droite.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 paniers de médicaments traditionnels. Elle se procure de ses produits au marché de Koutiala et pleine brousse. Elle vend ses articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabougnouma comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 77 500CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Kadiatou  compte réaliser  90 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce. .
texts.en:
Sabougnouma is a group of women from Koutiala who live in big traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. They are an average age of 38, are married with an average of 4 children.
This group of women sells various items such as traditional medicines, condiments, and other miscellaneous items. To increase the size of their operations, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their third loan. 
Marie is a member of the Sabougnouma group. She is the second person from the left.
She plans to use her loan to buy 20 baskets of traditional medicines. She provides her products at the market in Koutiala and in the bush. She sells the products in cash or credit at home and at the market to a diverse clientele. 
While the other Sabougnouma  group members expect to make an average profit of 77 500CFA  each during the loan cycle, Kadiatou expects to make  90 000FCFA.  
In addition to the repayment of the loans, they will use a portion of the revenue to meet personal expenses and grow their business.

loans.use: to buy traditional medicines

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe. She previously used an 30,000 PHP loan to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Fe hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to give her family a good future. She also hopes to have her house renovated. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. At these meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies of feed and hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Nzalambi

texts.en: Nzalambi works selling fruit and vegetables. She lives with her family and works to provide for their needs. She believes that she’s managed to attain the basics for her family by means of her business. She’s asking for a loan to buy tomatoes, potatoes, onions and other produce needed for her business. She believes buying more seasonal produce will help increase her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, onions and other produce for her business.

loans.name: Exea

texts.en: Exea, 25 and single, lives in the West Point community. Exea has been involved in this business for the past three years. She sells peppers, salt, palm oil, onions, vita (a juice drink), in her community. She received the initial capital from her father and started first in the business by buying and selling  mineral water. She is proud of her business because she makes profit every day and is self-reliant. She has requested a loan to purchase more peppers, vita, palm oil, salt, and onions for the business. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, juice drinks, palm oil, salt, and onions for the business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa 40, is married and resides with her husband at West Point, in the Vai town community. She has five children between the ages of six and 21. Three of her children live with other relatives; only two of the children stay with her at home. She would like to give the best education to her children, but she lacks financial support. 

For the past nine years, she has been selling coal by retail, and peppers, onions, vita, and salt at the community market. She sells six days a week, from 7am to 5pm. Some difficulties she faces include having few commodities. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal, pepper, vita, and onions to increase her sales. She hopes to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more coal, pepper, vita, and onions to increase her sales

loans.name: Nyae

texts.en:
Nyae is a married man with four children. He has bred cattle and cows for the last six years.

Nyae usually buys small goats, raises and fattens them for five to six months and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Nyae also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. His wife also helps him to pasture and sell livestock.

He wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. Thus, he has applied for a Kes 10,000 loan to purchase three goats. This will be his fifth loan and he has good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase three goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion works hard to support her family. Salvacion is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Salvacion requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

Salvacion has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Salvacion would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
This is Jolly; she previously requested a loan of 14,000 PHP that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more merchandise items and products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business definitely help her sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jolly dreams of being able to give all her children a good, high quality education through her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. These fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
This is Magdalena, 65, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Magdalena operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round palm sized ones, to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. She also sells dried fish. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. Part of the loan will be used in buying dried fish. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Magdalena hopes to increase production and dreams that her family will be business minded through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Togtokhsuren

texts.en: Mr. Togtokhsuren, 39 years old, lives with his wife and 3 children in Kherlen, the largest city of eastern province of Mongolia. He has been running taxi business for 6 consequent years and his wife is an ice cream vendor. His elder two children go to secondary school, and little one oversees their home. In winter, the ice cream business is quite good, so his family decided to buy a large amount of ice cream from Russia. On the other hand, in summer the nuts business prospers in this region, so Mr. Togtokhsuren decided to buy large amount of nuts in advance to sell for next summer. Also, he is very thankful for the lenders that financed his previous loan as it helped him greatly. This time, he is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan. By doing so, it will help him to finance their children’s education and other expenses. Mr. Togtokhsuren is a very hard working individual and believes in his future.

loans.use: to purchase nuts

loans.name: Jema

texts.en:
Jema is 45 years old, and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Jema is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jema has been pig-fattening for 5 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell plastic toys business in the Philippines. 
She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of toys to sell for her business.
Jocelyn has been in this business for 12 years. Jocelyn earns more income from fishing.
Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of toys to sell

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима обратилась в МДО «Арванд» для получения кредита, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота.   Она содержит дома несколько голов скота.    Эта основная работа в их регионе. Откорм скота  является единственным источником дохода.    Этот вид деятельности   являются очень актуальными, поэтому ее семья всерьез занимается этим делом, чтобы  прокормиться.     У них большая семья и работа в кишлаке хватает не на всех, многие сельчане  уезжают в Россию на заработки, но Фотима не хочет отправлять свою семью в чужую страну и старается сама их прокормить.    Для этого она хочет получить кредит в Арванде чтобы купить несколько голов скота  и продолжить развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en: Fotima has approached MDO Arvand for a loan to increase her herd of cattle. She keeps several head of livestock at home, and this is the main livelihood in the region where she lives. Fattening cattle is her sole source of income. This type of work is currently in demand, which is why her family is working hard at it, so they can support themselves in this way. They have a large family and there is not enough employment for everyone in the village where they live. Many villagers have to go to the Russian Federation to earn money as migrant workers, but Fotima does not want to send any of her family to a foreign country so she is trying to provide for them herself. For this reason, Fotima wants to get a loan from Arvand to buy several head of cattle to continue to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan con 54 años de edad, originario de Boaco, casado, padre de 4 hijos entre las edades de 7, 14, 16 y 20 años respectivamente, de oficio agricultor. Anteriormente el se dedicaba solo a la ganadería, pero ahora actualmente se dedica a la agricultura, como es la siembra de maíz y frijoles. El inicio sus actividades agrícolas  con dinero que su padre le  dio, el  vende sus producto en la misma ciudad en donde vive, sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio.
Juan en esta ocasión esta solicitando el préstamo para pago de mano de obra y  comprar la alimentación como  concentrado para su ganado. Lo  cual le será de ayuda, ya que al comprar mas ganado, aumentaría su producción de animales y asi podrá obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes futuros es ahorrar dinero para hacerle mejoras a su finca y mantener en buenas condiciones a sus animales.
texts.en: Juan is 54 years old and is a native of Boaco. He is a married father of four children, ages 7, 14, 16 and 20, and is a farmer. He previously made a living solely in livestock, but now he also plants corn and beans. He started the farming with money that his father gave him, and he sells his products in the same city where he lives. His expectations are to grow his business. Juan is requesting the loan to pay for labor and to purchase concentrated feed for his cattle. This will be helpful so he can purchase more cattle and increase his animals' production, so he will be able to have more profits. His plans for the future are to save money to make improvements to his farm, and to maintain good conditions for his animals.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to purchase concentrated feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Nueva Generacion Iii Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron hace varios años el banco comunal “Nueva Generación III” en la ciudad del Cusco por lo tanto actualmente se encuentra en el XXI ciclo y el banco comunal está conformado por mujeres y varones que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de las socias son por ejemplo; venta de desayunos, venta de comida, venta de productos de ferretería, venta de zapatos, venta de comestibles, venta de pollo a la brasa y venta de chompas.
 
Olga es miembro del banco comunal, ella tiene 56 años y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos. Olga nos cuenta con mucho orgullo que está sacando adelante a sus hijos y con ayuda de su pareja. Olga tiene un pequeño restaurante donde vende almuerzo pero en las tardes vende salchipapas y pollipapas. En esta oportunidad Olga requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo pollos, papas, salchichas y otras cosas más. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (El socio que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidió permiso para no estar presente el día de la reunión)
texts.en:
Some years ago, a group of neighbors and friends formed the communal bank "Nueva Generacion III" (New Generation III) in the city of Cusco. They are now in their 21st loan cycle. The communal bank is formed by seven men and seven women who are hardworking and entrepreneurial and who are always looking for opportunities to grow and succeed through their daily efforts to make a better future for their children. The members' business activities include selling breakfasts, selling meals, selling hardware, selling shoes, selling food, selling grilled chicken, and selling jackets.

Olga is a member of the communal bank. She is 56 years old and married, and the fruit of this beautiful marriage is four children. Olga tells us with great pride that she is succeeding with her children with the help of her husband. Olga has a small restaurant where she sells lunches, but in the afternoons she sells salchipapas and pollipapas (sausages and french fries). With this opportunity, Olga is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients such as chicken, potatoes, salchichas and other items.

All of the members are grateful for the opportunity they have received and promise to make their payments on time, in the agreed-upon manner.

(The member who appears in the inset photo requested permission to not be present on the day of the meeting.)

loans.use: purchase ingredients such as chicken, potatoes, salchicha and other items.

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru:
Раджабгулу 40 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж Давлатали очень добрый человек, но он не в состоянии обеспечить своих детей и жену со всеми не обходимыми средствами, а дети растут и требуют больше благ. Раджабгул много лет жила в бедности и очень ей было трудно. Итак, с целью улучшения условия проживания она начала свой новый бизнес шитьем женских платьев. У нее очень старая швейная машинка, каждый раз сломается и шьет очень не красиво и поэтому у нее мало клиентов, и она не может развевать свой бизнес. Она планирует купить новую швейную машинку для развития нового бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки.
 От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rajabgul is forty years old.  She's married and has four children.  Her husband, Davlatali, is a very kind person but he is not able to provide his wife and children with necessities, especially as the children grow and require more.  Rajabgul lived in poverty many years and it was difficult.  With the goal of improving her quality of life, she started her own business sewing women's dresses.  She has a very old sewing machine which breaks frequently and doesn't stitch very well.  Because of this, she has few clients and can't grow her business.  She's planning to buy a new sewing machine to help her new business grow.  She is asking for 500 somonis to buy the machine.  With her revenue, she plans to provide her children with an education and nutritious food.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her new business

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина женщина 34лет, замужем , имеет четверых детей.   Сама работает  на заводе.   Её муж работает строителем,на частной стройке.     Узнав от знакомой о возможности в кредит осуществить свои планы, она решила обратится в нашу организацию.   Ей необходимо купить кухонный гарнитур.  Из своей заработной платы Зарина  вполне может погашать запрашиваемый кредит. Зарина и в дальнейшем планирует  сотрудничать с Арванд.
texts.en: Zarina is 34 year old, married with four children. She works in a factory. Her husband is a construction worker at a private building site. Having learned from a friend about the possibility of a loan, she decided to contact Arvand in order to achieve her plans. She needs to buy a kitchen set. Her salary will enable her to repay the requested loan. Zarina plans to continue to cooperate with the Arvand in the future.

loans.use: purchase furniture

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée le 06 Juillet 2006. Il est composé de membres qui ont une bonne cohésion sociale et pratiquent comme activité le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Fatou est l'emprunteur en vedette. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle va investir la totalité de la somme dans l'achat de légumes pour revendre. 

Les bénéfices générés par l'activité elle renforce ses épargnes et améliore les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was formed on July 6, 2006. It consists of members who have good social cohesion and are shopkeepers.

Standing to the right in the photo and raising her hand, Fatou is the featured borrower. She is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of 7 children of whom 4 are boys.

With the loan received, she is going to invest the total sum in the purchase of vegetables to resell.

With the profits generated by her business she is going to strengthen her savings and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es: El grupo "Lucero" está conformado por nueve integrantes todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras pero sobretodo muy alegres. Ellas viven en una comunidad muy tranquila  donde la mayor parte de las personas se dedican al cultivo de maíz. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron ellas, entre varias opciones fue el que más les gustó. Lucero, una de las integrantes, platica que tiene 33 años de edad está casada con el señor Zeferino desde hace varios años y juntos han formado una familia con dos niños que se encuentran estudiando. Lucero Platica que ella llego a vivir a esa comunidad aunque nació en otra parte, Lucero se dedica a la crianza y venta de becerros cuenta que los compra desde pequeños los crece cuidándolos muy bien dándoles el alimento necesario que es maíz, zacate pero también muchas veces tiene que vitaminarlos para que no enfermen y mueran, ella tiene siete años en con su actividad y la inicio porque cuando llego a vivir con sus suegros a Lucero le encantaba ordeñar a las vacas y esto lo aprendió mientras vivía con  sus padres, entonces gracias  al primer crédito que le otorgo la institución decidió comprar sus primer becerrito aunque sus suegros tenían borregos no le llamaba tanta la atención el sueño de Lucero era tener becerros. Lucero comento “Me gustan mucho las vaquitas y ordeñarlas cuando dan leche sin embargo mi dificultad es cuando mis bueyes enferman y muchas veces no se recuperan y mueren y eso para mí es una perdida enorme para mis ganancias, me gustaría recibir algún tipo de capacitación para poder cuidar mejor a mis animales”. A pesar de las dificultades que presenta desea que su actividad siga creciendo para poder mejorar el corral de sus becerros, ya que si sus becerros están bien dan los resultados que Lucero espera será una muy buena manera de asegurar la vejez de ella y su esposo para sus hijos quiere que terminen una carrera profesional para que ellos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Así como Lucero tiene su actividad también la tienen las otras integrantes del grupo como Doña Ana Lilia y Vanessa invertirán en su tienda de abarrotes, Francisca y Rocío invertirán en dulces, Aurelia comprara borregos, Elena invertirá en ropa y calzado, Josefina comprara pollos, Margarita comprara bueyes. Todas ellas conforman el grupo son mujeres que tienen grandes deseos de sacar adelante a su familia. Ellas están muy agradecidas con la institución y con KIVA por el crédito otorgado ya que para ellas a sido de gran ayuda para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Lucero" [Bright Star] group has nine members, all hardworking but, above all, very happy, women.  They live in a quiet community where the majority of people earn their living growing corn.  They selected the group's name from among a number of options; it was the one they liked best.  Lucero, one of the members, tells us that she's thirty-three, and has been married to Zeferino for several years, and together they have two children who are in school.  

Lucero says that, although she was born elsewhere, she came to live in this community. She makes her living raising and selling calves.  She buys them when they are small, raises and cares for them very well, giving them the food they need like corn and feed.  But she often needs to give them vitamins so they don't get sick and die.  She has been in business for seven years, having started out when she came to live with her in-laws.  She loved milking the cows, which she had learned while living with her parents.  Then, thanks to the first loan she received from the Institution, she decided to buy her first calf.
