Although her in-laws had sheep, she didn't pay much attention because it was her dream to have calves.

She says, "I really love cows and milking.  However, the hard part is when they get sick and oftentimes don't recover, and die.  It's an enormous loss of income, and I would like to get some kind of training so I can care for my animals better."  Difficulties aside, Lucero wants the business to keep growing so she can improve the corral; if the cow are doing well they'll produce.  Lucero is hoping that this will provide good security for her and her husband in their old age, and that their children will get professional degrees so they can have a better quality of life.

Other members of the group have their own businesses, just like Lucero:  Ana Lilia and Vanessa will invest in their grocery store; Francisca and Rocío will invest in candy; Aurelia will buy sheep; Elena will invest in clothing and shoes; Josefina will buy chickens; and Margarita will buy bulls.  All the women in the group have a great desire make their families succeed.  They are very grateful to the Institution and to Kiva for the loan because it has been a big help in allowing them to improve their families' quality of life.

loans.use: to buy calves.

location.town: El Obraje, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Cerro Mojarra Group

texts.es:
En la comunidad de Cerro Mojarra existe un grupo integrado por 13 personas, en esta comunidad una de las principales fuentes de empleo es la pesca ya que en este pueblo hay una laguna.

Los integrantes del grupo son: Maria del Refugio venta de pescado, Agustina venta de pan, Maria Magdalena venta de perfumes, Blanca Esthela reposteria, Carmen Linda  venta de pescado, Candido venta de pescado, Araceli venta de antojitos, Laura venta de pescado, Rosa Isela venta de ropa, David taller de costura, Braulio venta de abarrotes, Maria de Jesus venta de pescado, Jovita venta de abarrotes.

Doña Maria del Refugio tiene la edad de 63 años, no estudio, es soltera y actualmente vive sola ya que sus hijos estan casados, Doña Cuco(como la llaman en su comunidad), platica que se crió en esta comunidad y desde muy pequeña aprendió de sus padres atrabajar para salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de mojara desde hace mas de 30 años. Comenta que en este mismo lugar crió a sus hijos y les enseño el oficio de la pesca. Doña Cuco realiza sus ventas de pescado en comunidades vecinas, en algunas ocasiones hace pasta de mole y también tiene algunos borregos en crianza. Ella comentó "yo he trabajado desde joven siempre para ver que mi familia este bien y tengamos nuestro dinerito para irla pasando no hay de otra solo trabajar duro y echarle muchas ganas para salir adelante". Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de mojarra para salir a venderla posteriormente. Ella espera a futuro continuar terminar la construcción de su casa y seguir trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
In the Cerro Mojarra [Small Fry Fish Hill] community there is a group made up of 13 people. In this community one of the main sources of employment is fishing since there is a lagoon in this town. 

The members of the group are: Maria del Refugio (selling fish), Agustina (selling bread), Maria Magdalena (selling perfume), Blanca Esthela (baking), Carmen Linda (selling fish), Candido (selling fish), Araceli (selling snacks), Laura (selling fish), Rosa Isela (selling clothes), David (tailor shop), Braulio (selling groceries), Maria de Jesus (selling fish), Jovita (selling groceries).

Doña Maria del Refugio is 63 years old, she did not go to school, is single and currently lives alone because her children are married. Doña Cuco (as they call her in her community), says she grew up in this community and since she was very young learnt from her parents to work hard to move ahead. She has been selling mojarra [small fry fish] for more than 30 years. She says that it is in this town that she took care of her kids and taught them how to fish. Doña Cuco makes her sales in nearby communities, in some occasions she makes mole [traditional mexican sauce] paste and also is raising some lambs.

She says "I have worked since I was young to make sure my family is allright and that we have a little money to get by. There is no other way but working hard and putting the effort to move ahead". She will invest this credit to buy mojarra and then resell it. She is hoping that in the future she will be able to finish building her home and wants to keep working to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy and sell fish

loans.name: Herenia

texts.es:
Herenia con 28 años de edad, soltera, madre de 1 hijo con 2 años, de oficio comerciante. Ella inicio desde muy joven a trabajar con su mama, luego a la edad de 21 años fue adquiriendo experiencia en la venta de ropa de forma ambulante, fue allí que  decidió independizarse con su propio negocio, del que es propietaria hace mas de 7 años, además de este negocio, tiene otro como es la venta de recarga telefónica, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana.
Ella esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar mas ropa como pantalones, blusas, shorts, falda y vestidos  etc. Ella estima que este préstamo le ayudaría mucho porque asi podrá comprar la mercadería que mas se vende. Sus planes futuros es poder tener un local propio. Su meta  es hacer crecer su negocio, comprando otros productos que aun no tiene en existencia y de esta manera obtener mejores ingresos y más clientela.
texts.en:
Herenia is 28 years old. She is single and is the mother of a two-year-old son. She is a retailer. She began to work with her mother when she was very young. Then at the age of 21 she acquired experience selling clothing as an street vendor. It was there that she decided to become independent with her own business, of which she has been the proprietor for more than 7 years. In addition to this business, she has another business, which is a mobile phone reloading service. She has the help of her sister.

She is applying for the loan to buy more clothing, such as pants, blouses, shorts, skirts, dresses, etc. She thinks that this loan will help her a lot, because this way she will be able to buy the merchandise that sells best. Her future plan is to have a store of her own. Her goal is to make her business grow, buying other products that she still does not have in stock, and in this way obtain better income and more customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothing such as pants, blouses, shorts, skirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
La señora Lidia Ester esta casada, tiene 29 años de edad, cursó los 2 años de educacion primaria, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales están estudiando 2, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inicio este negocio haciendo un préstamo con sus familiares y hasta ahora lleva 12 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de labores, hilos de diferentes clase y colores para tejido y la compra de caña donde enrollara su hilos de tejido, espera en el futuro tener trabajadores y otros telares. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la tejeduría, la crianza de animales y a la tejeduría.
texts.en: Lidia Ester is married, 29 years old and had two years of elementary school. She has three children, two in school, and she makes a living knitting typical garments. She started the business with a loan from a relative and has 12 years of experience. She counts on the support of her husband, who makes a living doing the same work. She organized a group to request a loan to purchase knitting needles and different kinds of yarn in a variety of colors. She hopes in the future to have employees and other knitters. The other members making a living in knitting (two members) and raising livestock.

loans.use: to purchase yarn and knitting needles.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El socio es el señor  Alejandro,  él continúa comercializando productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes, actividad que representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia. Alejandro está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, bebidas y golosinas para capitalizar su actividad.  Alejandro agradece a  KIVA por permitirle seguir trabajando y desarrollándose en su actividad económica.
Alejandro pertenece al banco “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú
texts.en:
The member is Alejandro.  He continues to sell basic needs in his grocery store, an activity that provides his family's primary source of income and upkeep.

Alejandro is applying for a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, drinks and snacks to reinvest in his business.  

Alejandro thanks KIVA for allowing him to continue working and developing his business.  Alejandro belongs to the "Los Lideres" (The Leaders) community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, milk, drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells fruit in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years and earns additional income from electronic re-loading (selling mobile phone credit).

Susana has been sustaining her business through hard work and with help from previous loans from NWTF (Kiva's regional field partner). She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fruit for her stall. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Christina sells waakye (a local dish made of rice and beans) at Akatakyiwa, which she has done for two years. Her husband is a carpenter. Christina uses her income to support her husband and take care of the children. She will use this loan to purchase more rice and beans to prepare the waakye. With the new profits, Christina plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and beans to prepare the waakye.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 34-year-old, Lebanese, married man living with his wife and one child who attends school. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2007. His main route is between his town and the surrounding villages. He also provides private transportation upon client request. His business income is highly important as he represents the only income source for the family. Since the car he drives is a rental car, today he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to be able to purchase this car. In that way, he will benefit from all the returns of his business and therefore increase his income by a fair percentage. This is his second Kiva loan and he hopes to be able to improve his business as well as his family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase this car

loans.name: Lorlina

texts.en:
Lorlina is 49 years old. She is a widow and has five children, and she works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling balut (a popular duck egg street food).

Lorina requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF (Kiva's field partner) to buy items like soap, rice, sugar, soft drinks, detergent and other groceries. She has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. Lorlina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy soap, rice, sugar, soft drinks, detergent and other groceries for her store.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Mariée sans enfant et âgée de 24 ans, Marguerite est une revendeuse de vêtements prêt à porter. Sa boutique dont elle est la seule gérante est ouverte depuis 2009 et profite de son ancienneté pour fidéliser ses clients. Elle sollicite auprès de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des vêtements afin de satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Elle veut économiser ses profits supplémentaires pour élargir sa boutique mais aussi ambitionne d’avoir une maison propre à elle  pour sa famille.
texts.en: Marguerite is 24 years old and married without children. She is a ready made clothing reseller. Her store, which she manages alone, was opened in 2009 and, due to its established nature, benefits from a loyal client base. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy clothing to meet her clients' demand. She wants to save her added profits to grow her boutique and also hopes to buy her own home for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Assoupi

texts.fr: Assoupi âgée de 42 ans,  pratique la revente des produits d’alimentation Générale dans une boutique de la place. Elle est mariée à un banquier et est mère de 05 enfants  tous scolarisés. Son premier enfant  a 17 ans et le dernier a 03 ans. Elle a débuté cette activité en 2003 et sollicite son troisième prêt auprès de WAGES pour acheter les produits alimentaires manquant dans sa boutique. Elle compte revendre ses produits et épargner ses profits pour ouvrir une seconde boutique plus tard. Elle souhaite contribuer avec son mari à offrir une meilleure condition de vie à sa famille.
texts.en: Assoupi is 42 years old and retails food products in a boutique in her neighborhood. She is married to a banker and the mother of 5 children, who all go to school. Her first child is 17 and her youngest is 3. She started her business in 2003 and is seeking her third loan from WAGES to buy food products that she doesn't have in her store. She hopes to resell the products and save her profits in order to open a second store in the future. She hopes to contribute with her husband to provide a better living standard for her family.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose, 40, is a hard working and loving mother to her four children who are between the ages of 20 and 28. Two of her children are independent, while the other two children are in school. Rose stopped her education in the 10th grade. She has a table in her community where she sells bread, butter, milk, vita, sardines, launcher meat, and many other items. She has been selling twelve hours a day for the last twelve years. Rose resides with her husband at West Point in the P.H.P. community. She is proud of her business because she makes profit and with the profit she is able to buy more goods and contribute to the house hold expenses. She has requested a loan to purchase more bread, milk butter, vita, and sardines for the business. Her plan for the future is to become an international business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more bread, milk, butter, vita, and sardines for the business.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Fournisseur de  gravier aux entrepreneurs et autres personnes, Elise tient cette activité depuis 2001. Veuve et mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés, elle est âgée de 40 ans. Son premier enfant a 14 ans et le dernier a 12 ans. Elle sollicite son premier prêt auprès de WAGES pour commander du gravier en stock. Elle veut destiner son profit à réaliser son projet d’ouverture d’une boutique de vente de pagne et de bijoux. Elle veut renforcer son activité principale et s’occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants et de l’amélioration de leur condition de vie.
texts.en:
Elise has been a gravel provider for contractors and other people since 2001. She is widowed and the mother of two children, all attending school. She is 40 years old. Her first child is 14 years old and the last one 12.

She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to stock up on gravel. She would like to dedicate her profit to the opening of a shop where she would sell “pagnes” [colorful African cloth] and jewelry. She wants to strengthen her main activity, take care of her children's school fees and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase gravel

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 19-year-old single man living in Lebanon. He and his parents and two siblings make a cooperative and united family. His father is the main income provider for the family. One of Abbas’s greatest dreams is to continue his education until graduation, so that he can start his own business and bring additional income to the family. 

Abbas has been working for a local company. Through his job, he will be able to pay the rest of his study fees. Even still, he finds it difficult to stand on his own. That’s why he asks today to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. The loan will help him achieve a good educational level and even pursue higher degrees. With this opportunity, he will start his own business and no doubt achieve a new and better way of living.

loans.use: to pay the rest of his study fees

loans.name: Banguka I Group

texts.fr:
Virginie fait partie du groupe  Banguka I et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 45 ans et est mariée à Berchmans, un commerçant de produits vivriers. Ensemble, ils ont  6 enfants  qui étudient.

Elle  fait le  commerce  de bananes  et de farine depuis 20 ans. 

Elle est à son douzième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital en achetant une grande quantité de bananes, à revendre, et introduire une deuxième activité : la vente de farine, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Virginie is a member or the Banguka I Group and lives in Gitega. She is 45 years old and is married to Berchmans, a shopkeeper selling staple foods. Together, they have six children who attend school.

Virginie has been selling bananas and flour for 20 years. She is on her twelfth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she will obtain, she is going to increase her capital by purchasing a large quantity of bananas to sell and begin a second business selling flour, in order to earn more.

loans.use: To increase her capital by purchasing a large quantity of bananas to sell and to begin a second business selling flour, in order to earn more.

loans.name: Cubwenge Ii Group

texts.fr:
Immaculée fait partie du groupe  Cubwenge et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Félix, un commerçant. Ensemble, ils ont 4 enfants dont  2 étudient.

Elle  fait le  commerce  de bananes depuis 20ans 20 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes, à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Le gain de son commerce lui permet de satisfaire les besoins familiaux (alimentation, soins de santé,…).
texts.en:
Immaculée is a member of the Cubwenge Group and lives in Gitega. She is 32 years old and is married to Felix, a shopkeeper. Together, they have four children, two of whom attend school.

Immaculée has been selling bananas for 20 years. She is on her second loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she will obtain, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of bananas to sell in order to earn more.

The profits from her business allow her to meet familial needs (food, healthcare, etc.).

loans.use: To increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of bananas to sell, in order to earn more.

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.fr: Jeune femme mariée de 23 ans, Jocelyne  est mère de 02, enfants tous scolarisés. Son ainé a 09 ans et son dernier a 04 ans. Elle revend de la friperie dans une boutique qu’elle tient depuis 2008. Elle sollicite son premier crédit auprès de WAGES pour payer une plus grande quantité  de friperie afin  d’augmenter ses revenus en les revendant. Elle veut pouvoir épargner pour ouvrir une grande boutique et assurer l’éducation de sa famille.
texts.en: A young married 23 year old, Jocelyne is the mother of two school aged children. Her eldest is 9 and the younger is 4. She resells used clothing in a shop  which she has had since 2008. She asked for her first loan from WAGES to buy a larger amount of used clothing in order to increase her profits from the sales. She wants to be able to save so she can open a larger shop and guarantee her family's education.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Norman

texts.en:
Norman is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. He is a farmer who has been running the trade for fifteen years. He started off in a small farm, mainly for subsistence and has grown to farm for commercial purposes.  

He was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access credit. Norman has had the challenge of most farm produce going to waste due to lack of transport/access to the market. He is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to purchase a motorcycle to transport the produce to the market. He has set his ambition to farm with irrigation and would like to purchase a water tank with the additional income from the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to transport the produce to the market.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Électricien auto depuis 2008, Komla est marié et père d’un enfant de 04 mois. Il est âgé de 23 ans et dispose d’un point de service ou boutique  où il pratique son activité. Il sollicite son premier prêt auprès de WAGES pour  acheter  un chargeur de batterie, un démarreur, et un alternateur afin de  faire tourner  sa boutique et mieux servir ses clients. Il souhaite épargner son profit auprès de notre institution et agrandir son activité afin d’élever le niveau de vie de son  jeune foyer.
texts.en: Komla has been an automotive electrician since 2008, and is married and the father of a 4-month-old child. He is 23 years old and has a store where he provides his services. He is seeking his first loan from WAGES to buy a battery charger, a starter, and an alternator in order to keep his business going and serve his clients. He wants to save his profits with WAGES and grow his business in order to raise the living standards of his young household.

loans.use: To buy chargers and batteries

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Célibataire sans enfant âgé de 30 ans, Kodzo est revendeur ambulant de chaussures. Très tôt en 1996, il a débuté cette activité et actuellement il manque des fonds de commerce. Il sollicite son second crédit auprès de WAGES pour acheter plus de chaussures pour la vente. Il souhaite agrandir son activité et mieux améliorer la condition de vie de sa future famille.
texts.en:
Single and with no children at 30 years old, Kodzo is a roving shoe vendor. He began this business very early in 1996 and currently lacks business funds. He is seeking his second loan from WAGES in order to purchase more shoes to sell.

Kodzo wishes to expand his business and create better living conditions for his future family.

loans.use: To purchase shoes.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Jovita works hard to support her family.
She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from vegetable vending and net working. Jovita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.
Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
This is Jose; he previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for he will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jose hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. At these meetings, he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 57 years old and is a widow with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like spices, canned goods, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Myrna has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like, spices, canned goods, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores works hard to support five children. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency. Dolores is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money; she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en: Gilda works hard to support her family. Gilda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Gilda requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store like spices, canned goods, sugar, milk, etc. Gilda has been in this business for 29 years now. In the future, Gilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ganerdene

texts.en:
Mr. Ganerdene, 39 years old, lives with his wife and 3 children in the ger district/rural area.  Living conditions are quite difficult in Mongolia in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

His income source is transportation services, and the payment is varied according to the length of road and environment. 

As winter comes to Mongolia, there is an urgent need for a warm house. His house has two rooms, which is very confining for 5 people to live. He decided to add one more room. However, he hasn’t finished his housing addition because he lacks financing.  

He is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT; this loan will enable him to live in a comfortable house with his family. He will then be able to work enthusiastically without worrying about the well being of his family members.

loans.use: to finish the room addition to his house.

loans.name: Raquela

texts.en:
Raquela works hard to support six children. She is married and has a buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines.

Raquela requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Raquela is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Rutchel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rutchel works hard to support her family.

She has running a buying and selling recycled materials business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from buying and selling vehicle spare parts. Rutchel is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more recycled materials to sell for her buying and selling recycled materials business.

Rutchel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Tuty

texts.ru: Тути 50 лет. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. У этой хорошей и прекрасной женщины очень тяжелая судьба, так как после смерти мужа она осталась одна без кормильца с 4 детьми. Ей было очень тяжело справляться с содержанием семьи. Ей никто никогда не помогает, и она собирается сама организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес  купле продажей женской и детской одежды. Она планирует торговать на местном рынке, так как там много народа делают покупки. Ее дети будут помогать ей в ведении бизнеса.  От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей хорошим условием проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Tuty is fifty years old.  She's the widowed mother of four children.  This good and wonderful woman has had a difficult life since. the death of her husband who was the breadwinner.  She was left to provide for her four children by herself.  She found it difficult to handle the pressure of supporting her family.  No one ever helps her and she is planning to start a business on her own and become successful in her trade.  With this goal in mind, she took the course "Bring it On", organized by the Association of Business Women, and received a certificate.  She wants to organize a business where she sells women's and children's clothing.  She plans to sell at a local market, where many do their shopping.  Her children will help her run the business.  With her loan, she plans to provide her children with a better quality of life.  She's asking for the sum of 2000 somoni to buy inventory for the new business.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy clothes to organize a new business

loans.name: Rubidia Milagro

texts.es:
Rubidia, solicita un préstamo para mejorar el inventario en el negocio de las frutas y verduras, para la temporada que se acerca, se comprara tomates, cebollas, papas, rábanos, zanahorias, güisquiles, repollos, con esta nueva inversión podrá mejorar las ventas.
Con el préstamo anterior Ella manifiesta que sus ventas han mejorado, tuvo algunos momentos difíciles para tener liquidez, ya que tuvo la muerte de un familiar, desequilibrándole su economía, manifiesta que tiene parientes que le ayudan para salir de la situacion.
texts.en:
Rubidia is requesting a loan to improve the inventory of her fruit and vegetable business for the approaching season.  She will purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes, radishes, carrots, chayotes, and cabbages.  She will be able to increase her sales with this new investment.  She states that her sales have improved with the help of the previous loan. 

 She went through some difficult times when her financial situation became unstable and she ran low on cash due to the death of a family member.  She states that she has relatives that are helping her get through the situation.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes, radishes, carrots and chayotes.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en: Nugzar is 46 years old and lives in the capital city - Tbilisi - with his wife and two children (7 and 14 years old). Nugzar is involved in car import business. He buys cars abroad and sells them in Georgia for a higher price. Several months ago Nugzar decided to start a new business to supplement his income but his loan requests have been rejected several times by local financial institutions. He lacks experience with new business start-ups and does not qualify under income requirements. Nugzar is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program provides startup and re-startup credits with reduced requirements for the rural poor who do not have access to many credit products - as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Nugzar will use his loan to start a store where auto parts and accessories will be sold. He has already chosen the space for his business and hopes that his business will be profitable. This will increase his monthly income and the new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to start an auto parts store

loans.name: Manos Unidas De Amadeo Repeto Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Manos Unidas de Amadeo Repeto” en la ciudad del Cusco y el banco comunal está conformado por mujeres y varones que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de las socias son por ejemplo; confección de ropas, venta de abarrotes, venta de comida los demás son profesionales en las aéreas de salud y arqueología.  

Charo es miembro del banco comunal, ella tiene 37 años y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos. Charo nos cuenta con mucho orgullo que está sacando adelante a sus hijos y con ayuda de su pareja. Charo es enfermera de profesión pero trabaja con un grupo de colegas haciendo proyectos de salud. En esta oportunidad Charo requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de escritorio como papel, lapiceros, tintas, cuadernos y otras cosas más.
 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed a village bank "Manos Unidas de Amadeo Repeto" in the city of Cusco.  The village bank is made up of men and women who are workers and entrepreneurs looking for opportunities to succeed and, with their daily efforts, create a better life for their children. Examples of the work of the members are for example: dressmaking, selling groceries, selling food, and professionals in the areas of health and archeology.  

Charo is a member of the village bank. She is 37 years old, married and together with her husband she has three children. Charo told us she is proudly raising her children with the help of her partner.  Charo is a nurse by profession, but she works with a group of colleagues on health projects. With this opportunity, Charo requires a loan to buy writing materials like paper, pencils, ink, notebooks and other materials. 

The members have appreciated the opportunity and have agreed to comply with the payment of their fees in due time.

loans.use: To buy writing materials like paper, pencils, inks, notebooks and other things.

loans.name: Mujeres De Choxbajan Group

texts.es:
La señora Marcela esta unida de hecho a su esposo, tiene 44 años de edad, cursó los 5 años de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales ninguno estudia, se dedica a la crianza de animales, inicio este negocio por la necesidad de superarse y sacar a delante a su familia y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de toros y cerdos, los cuales los venderá cuando sean grande y tener una ganancia, espera en el futuro tener un negocio mas amplio y con mejor ingreso. La demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales, al comercio y a la artesanía.
texts.en:
Marcela is married, 44 years old, completed 5 years of primary school and has two children who have not attended school. She raises animals and started this business to improve life for her family. She has 10 years of experience.  

She organized this group to ask for a loan to buy bulls and pigs, which she will sell when they are bigger to make a profit. She hopes that in the future she will have a bigger business and greater income. The others in her group also raise animals, trade, or make crafts.

loans.use: Buy cattle and pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Familia M Group

texts.es: “Familia M” tiene ya varios ciclos trabajando con la institución el grupo esta conformado por cuatro integrantes todos son familiares es por eso que eligieron ese nombre. Doña Juana quien es la representante del grupo platica que tiene 46 años de edad esta casada con el señor Fidencio desde hace varios años juntos formaron una familia pero en la actualidad ya no tienen dependientes Doña Juana se dedica a la venta de plásticos como fibras, cubetas, tinas, entre otras cosas, esta vez está solicitando el crédito para comprar más mercancía, la actividad de Doña Juana la inicio desde hace 12 años y platica que la inicio porque le gustaba trabajar. La meta cuando inició su negocio fue tener una actividad donde ella misma administrara su tiempo, donde ella pudiera abrir y cerrar a la hora que quisiera. Doña Juana esta muy contenta y agradecida con el crédito de VisionFund y Kiva "...porque mi negocio se ha podido levantar y crecer poco a poco". Doña Juana ya es una persona grande lo único que desea es asegurar su calidad de vida para cuando ya no pueda trabajar el resto del grupo también tienen sus diferentes actividades productivas como Don Jesús invertirá en ropa, Don Fidencio en Bisutería y Andrea en ropa de bebé y lencería estos son los integrantes del grupo son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables con la institución ya que comentan que gracias al crédito que les han otorgado han podido mejorar sus negocios y su calidad de vida como familia.
texts.en:
"Familia M" already has various cycles working with this institution.  The group is formed by four members who are all family, and this is how they chose the name.  Doña Juana who is the representative of the group is 46 years old and is married to señor Fidencio.  Together for several years, they have a family, but currently do not have dependents.  

Doña Juana sells plastics such as fibers, buckets, and tubs as well as other things.  She started her business 12 years ago because she enjoys working.  Her goal when she began was to have a business in which she herself would administer her time, where she could open and close at the hour she wanted.  This time Doña Juana is applying for the loan to buy more merchandise.  She is very happy and grateful for the loans from Visionfund and Kiva "...because my business has been able to pick up and grow little by little."  Doña Juana is a great person.  The only thing she desires is to ensure her quality of life for when she is no longer able to work.

The rest of the group also have their different business activities.  Don Jesús will invest in clothing, Don Fidencio in costume jewelry, and Andrea in baby clothing and undergarments.  The members of the group are very hardworking and responsible people.  They are thankful to the institution for the loans they have been awarded that have made their businesses better and increased their quality of life as a family.

loans.use: to buy plastic products such as buckets, tubs, fibers, etc.

location.town: Santa Cruz Mextepec, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Teresa, 46, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Eluminado and is mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages the household and runs the familiy business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Teresa runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of anything. In Yolanda’s case, she is selling used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked on a table or mat. Some special items are displayed in hangers. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, many people buy their clothes used from “ukay-ukay” stalls. These are much cheaper than brand new clothes sold in malls. Since her stall is located in an urban poor public market, her business flourishes. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) net sales every day. 

To help her expand the business, Ma. Teresa is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of used, yet high-quality, clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. So, she plans to add more pants and jeans, as well as used bags and footwear. If she can continue the profits from this loan, she can meet the customers’ demand. Through proper management of capital and profit, she can expand her business and boost its income.

Ma. Teresa hopes to give her children a good future and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This group is also a place where she can draw strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of used-but-quality clothes needed in her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has three children and he is the sole provider for his family. Ali owns a small restaurant/cafe that he started in 2009. He has gained good experience in this field and he is well known with an excellent reputation in the surrounding area. He is requesting a loan of $3,000 to renovate his shop and to install ceramic on the walls of his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to install ceramic on his shop’s walls.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
Félix un humilde agricultor, de 54 años de edad, es originario de la Comarca el Riego, Santa lucia, Municipio Boaco. Con un conocimiento académico de primaria, es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica a la siembra de  frijol, desde hace 30 años, padre de 5 hijos mayores de edad, viven independiente. Félix  inicio su actividad a los 15 años de edad ayudándoles a sus padres en las tierras, luego decide independizarse, después de haber obtenido experiencia y dominio en el negocio empieza a trabajar por si solo en la siembras. Hoy en día con esfuerzo propio no solo siembra granos básicos, también siembra otro tipo de cultivo de hortalizas como cebolla, en sus propias tierras que ha obtenido de las ganancias del trabajo, en su negocio  paga mano de obra debido a que la carga del trabajo es mucha no puede hacerlo por si solo, sus productos los comercializa en la misma comunidad y en los alrededores de la zona. Él quiere realizar todas las labores de la siembra como limpiar el grano de frijol para que la producción sea mejor que la de años pasados.
Solicita el crédito para pagar mano de obra, comprar insumos, fertilizantes y abono, el cual será de ayuda porque podrá realizar sus labores de cosecha en tiempo y forma, sus planes futuros es cancelar el crédito de las ganancias que saque de la cosecha y lo que sobre invertirlo en la compra de tierras, su expectativa es mantener su negocio activo para poder salir adelante, tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Felix is a humble farmer.  He’s 54 years old and originally from the Riego Santa Lucia community in Boaco.  He has an elementary school education and is a very hardworking man who has been raising beans for 30 years.  He has five adult children living on their own.

Felix began farming, helping his parents on their land, when he was 15.  He later decided to go out on his own after gaining some experience.  He succeeded in the business and now he only works with it during planting season.

Now he not only raises basic grains, but also other types of vegetables such as onions on land that he bought with the profits from his work.  He pays for labor because there is too much work for him to do it alone.  He sells his products in his community and all around the zone.  He wants to do all the planting labors, such as cleaning the bean seed so that production will be greater than in previous years.

He is asking for this loan to pay for labor and buy supplies, fertilizer, and compost which will be helpful because he will be able to do his harvesting on time and in a good manner.  His future plans are to repay the loan and invest in more land.  His expectations are to maintain his business active in order to be able to get ahead and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for labor and supplies.

loans.name: Santos Del Carmen

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su esposo y tienen tres hijos pequeños, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de loza, ella aprendió el trabajo con su madre, quien le enseño el oficio desde las 9:00am comienza su jornada hasta las 4:30, con esta actividad ha logrado mantener su hogar y el negocio. La loza es el trabajo de artesanos con barro, elaborando ollas, comales, sartenes.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertir en el negocio, compra de leña, barro, nacazcol (es la semilla que se machaca en agua, luego se disuelve en las creaciones de barro), este préstamo será de mucha ayuda pues el negocio necesita material para continuar en el trabajo.
Sus aspiraciones son, tener un puesto propio del negocio, tener su propia casa, que sus hijos crezcan sanos y se superen.
texts.en: Santos lives with her husband and has three small children. She makes a living making and selling craft crockery. She learned the trade for her mother and works from 9 a.m. until 4:30 p.m. With this activity she has been able to provide for her home and business. The crockery is made from clay, and Santos makes pots, pans and griddles. She is requesting the loan to invest in her business, purchasing firewood, clay and nacazcol (a seed that is crushed in water that dissolves into the clay). This loan will be a big help because she needs materials to continue with the business. Her dreams are to have her own sales post, to have her own home, and for her children to grow up healthy and move up in life.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and clay.

loans.name: Maira Estela

texts.es:
Maira, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque quiere comprar dos cerdos para el destazo, tambien comprara 8 sacos de maíz, esto es lo al momento le hace falta para la función del negocio.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a incrementar las ventas tanto de las tortillas como en los cerdos para el destazo, tener más ingresos, que ha logrado cubrir las necesidades del hogar, esta agradecida por darle el financiamiento y espera seguir siendo cliente.
texts.en:
Maria is applying for a new loan because she wants to buy two pigs to butcher. She will also buy 8 sacks of corn. This is what she needs now to run her business.

She states that the previous loan helped her to increase her sales, as much from tortillas as from the pigs for butchering, and to have more income, and she succeeded in covering the household necessities. She is thankful that she was given the financing and hopes to continue being a [loan] customer.

loans.use: to buy two pigs

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, vive con su familia, su esposa y cinco hijos, solo él trabaja en la familia, esta ocupación la aprendió de su padre, lo involucro desde joven en las siembras, no tiene un horario fijo.
Solicita un préstamo porque está realizando la siembra y para esto deberá comprar abono e insecticidas, que son insumos necesarios para aplicarlos al cultivo, la compra le permitirá tener lo necesario para trabajar.
Con el cultivo su objetivo es tener buenos resultados en la cosecha, tambien generar ventas y con las ganancias ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is a farmer.  He lives with his family -- his wife and five children.  He is the only one in the family who works.  

He learned his trade from his father, who involved him in planting from a young age.  He doesn't have a fixed schedule.  

He is applying for a loan because he is in the process of planting and for this he needs to buy fertilizer and insecticides -- necessary inputs to apply to the crop.  The purchase will allow him to get what he needs to work.  His goal for the crop is to have a good harvest and also to generate sales and help his children with the earnings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada, su esposo tiene 25 años, no tienen hijos y los dos trabajan, él lo realiza en un taller, con ello le ayuda a cubrir parte de los gastos del hogar, Martha se dedica a la venta de ropa, trabaja con la ayuda de su madre, este negocio lo aprendió con su madre, trabajan de lunes a sábado.
Ella solicita un préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropa variada, para damas y niños en blusas, faldas, ropa interior, esta compra le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener más ingresos.

La aspiración de Martha es fortalecer el negocio a través de los préstamos, ofreciendo una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Martha sells clothing. She is 21 years old. She is married, and her husband is 25. They have no children, and they both work. He works in a workshop. With it, he helps her cover part of the household expenses. Martha sells clothing. She works with the help of her mother. She learned this business from her mother. They work from Monday to Saturday.

She is applying for a loan to be able to invest in the purchase of a variety of clothing for women and children -- blouses, skirts, and underwear. This purchase will help her to increase her inventory and obtain more income.

Martha's goal is to strengthen her business through the loans, offering a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, and underwear to sell

loans.name: Ingrid Yamileth

texts.es:
Ingrid, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder realizar un nuevo cultivo de granos básicos, se comprara tres sacos de abono y pagara mano de obra, con esta compra realizara la siembra con todo lo necesario.
Con el préstamo anterior ella tuvo un efecto positivo, pues su cosecha se aumento y la producción logro vender para utilizar el dinero en su familia, considera que está mejorando su trabajo en el campo debido a la utilidad de los préstamos Kiva.
texts.en: Ingrid has decided to apply for a new loan in order to plant a new crop of basic grains.  She will buy three sacks of fertilizer and she will pay a farmhand.  She will be able to complete the planting of the crop with the help of this loan.  Her previous loan had a positive effect as her harvest grew and she was able to sell her production to have money for her family.  She believes that her farm work is improving on account of her use of Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer and to pay a farmhand.

loans.name: Misozi

texts.en:
Misozi is 22 years old. She owns a mobile money transfers shop in Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia. She comes from a family of five.

Misozi describes her business as the service of sending and receiving money. She is very proud of the fact that she has been able to start her business from scratch. Before Misozi started her own business, she worked at Zoona as an Agent Administrator, which gave her a clear sense of how the business works.

Misozi is taking out a Kiva loan so that she can increase her float. Float is the working capital that she uses to serve her customers. Right now, the float is not enough because her shop is located in the centre of town, where the demand is so high that she cannot satisfy all the customers. She will also use part of her loan money to purchase a tin of paint so that she can paint her shop.

This loan will enable Misozi to serve more customers and earn more profits. The profits will help her to pay for her studies and help out at home. She thanks the Kiva lenders.

In this video, a representative from Zoona interviews Misozi at her shop.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and paint her shop

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
This is Ernesto. He previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase larger quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in his family’s personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ernesto hopes to be able to expand soon and fulfill his dreams to give a good and quality education to his children. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes, 58 and a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rodrigo, a businessman, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lourdes operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  Lourdes hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham, 48, lives in Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. His wife Judith is a housekeeper and mother to their children. They both work very hard to provide for their family. Abraham earns a living by running a variety store where he sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to people in his neighborhood. His store is next to to his house, and he earns a minimum of PHP 350 in sales every day. He is requesting a loan for PHP 18,000 to buy more items to sell to his customers. He expects the loan to boost his business income. Abraham faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from his religion.

*All CCT community partner /clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study religion, build social capital and replay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in his grocery store.

loans.name: Mohruhsor

texts.ru: Мохрухсору 29 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она очень добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Ее родители очень гордятся ею. Она несколько лет назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей женской одежды, но так как у нее не было опыта, она не смогла развевать свой бизнес. Теперь она решила организовать бизнес купле продажей канцтоваров. На этот раз она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. От полученного дохода она планирует помогать родителем для улучшения условия проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mohruhsor is twenty nine years old.  She is not married and she lives with her parents.  She is a very kind and hardworking woman.  Her parents are very proud of her.  She started her own business a few years ago, selling stationary.  Because of a lack of opportunity, she was unable to develop her business.  Now, she decided to organize another stationary business.  In preparation, she's taken the course "Bring it On", organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate.  Now she has the ability to organize her business and become successful in the trade.  With her revenue, she plans to help her parents improve their quality of life.  She's asking for the sum of 1,000 somoni to purchase inventory to organize her new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy stationery to organize a new business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Ms Rehana is a 47-year-old married woman. Two years ago she started a general store in the corner of her house on a very small scale. Now she has many regular customers and makes enough to lead a decent life as her husband’s income is not sufficient to cover the daily expenses of the household.

She is a mother of four children; all of them are going to school. She needs to purchase more goods to fully stock her store and meet the demands of her customers as time goes on. For this she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase stock of rice, sugar and flour at wholesale prices from the market. In this way her earnings will improve and she intends to utilize this for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, sugar and flour at wholesale prices from the market.

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Faida, leader du groupe d’affaire «Zawadi », est entrepreneur courageux, âgée d’environ 48 ans, mariée, mère de 9 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un petit commerçant. Elle est vendeuse des de denrées alimentaires (arachides, ndagara, etc.). Environs 12 ans, elle exerce ces petites activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 21 cycles de crédit dans le programme de microcrédit de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau prêt  doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 2 sacs des arachides, 1 sac de ndagara, etc. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et accroitre son entreprise. Les bénéfices de ses activités lui servent de réaliser l’épargner, de payer la scolarité, l’habillement, la nourriture, etc., pour sa famille. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes non bancables. Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en: The client Faida, leader of the business group Zawadi, is a courageous entrepreneur. She is about 48 years old, married and the mother of 9 young children who all study. Her husband is a shopkeeper. She sells foodstuffs (groundnuts, ndagara [small local fish], etc.). She has been practicing these small businesses for about 12 years. However, she has just completed 21 loan cycles with the micro loan programme of the MFI Hekima. This new loan must serve to stock her up with 2 bags of groundnuts, 1 bag of ndagara [small local fish], etc. In addition, she wishes to see her children grow and grow her business. The profits from her businesses allow her to save, and to pay for the schooling, clothing, food, etc., for her family. The client thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women who are not bankable. It is proper to indicate that one client is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of groundnuts, 1 bag of ndagara [small local fish], etc.

loans.name: Dambé Group

texts.fr:
Dambé est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les médicaments, les fruits et légumes, les friperies, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe. 
Rokia est un membre du groupe Dambé arrête première personne à droite, qui vend des fruits.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 chargements de charrettes de bananes auprès des producteurs. Elle vend ses articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Dambé comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 136 500CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Rokia compte réaliser  160 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Dambé is a group of women from Koutiala who all live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and parents. They are on average 32 years old, married, and have five children on average. 

This group of women engage in diverse business activities such as medicine, fruits and vegetables, second-hand clothing, and more. 

To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to parter with Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their third group loan.

Rokia is a member of the Dambé group and is on the far right in the photograph. She sells fruit. 

She would like to use her loan to buy five cartloads of bananas from producers. She sells them for retail and credit from home and in the market to a diverse and varied clientele. 

While the other Dambé group members will achieve a monthly profit of 136,500 FCFA each during the course of this loan cycle, Rokia expects to earn 160,000 FCFA. 

In addition to loan repayment, they will use a portion of their income to take care of personal expenses and increase their working capital.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Las Mazahuas Group

texts.es: “Las Mazahuas” es un grupo que lleva varios años trabajando con la institución son mujeres que siempre han tratado de darle lo mejor a su familia. Eligieron el nombre porque dicen que son mujeres cuya lengua materna es el mazahua. Doña Claudia, una de las integrantes, tiene 54 años de edad está casada con el señor Francisco desde hace 35 años y juntos han formado una familia con nueve hijos solo tres de ellos aun dependen de Doña Claudia y Don Francisco. Doña Claudia se dedica a la cría y engorda de vacas lecheras, las compra desde pequeñas las crece y engorda cuando ya están bien para que sean preñadas por un buey macho hace que sus vacas sean preñadas para que cuando nazca el becerro la vaca produzca leche, esta vez Doña Claudia esta solicitando el crédito para comprar una vaca lechera y su alimento Doña Claudia platica que desde hace 30 años inicio con la crianza de sus vacas y la inicio porque quería apoyar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos. La señora Claudia comento “Desde niña me gustaba cuidar y ver como nacían los becerros” aunque las dificultades de Doña Claudia son grandes como la falta de alimento para sus vacas no puede comprar en cantidades grandes ya que es muy caro, pero también cuando sus vacas se enferman y mueren para la señora Claudia es una pérdida de ganancias, a pesar de esto Doña Claudia es una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora  es por eso mismo que su meta es llegar a tener tantas vacas lecheras que produzcan en cantidades grandes para poder vender a más personas, poder llegara a elaborar queso con la misma leche de sus vacas, ya que con todas sus ganancias podría seguir apoyando a sus hijas que aun están estudiando y quieren terminar su carrera profesional porque cada una de ellas tiene sueños diferentes. Las integrantes del grupo también desean superarse es por eso que están solicitando el crédito para invertirle en sus actividades productivas como las señoras Raquel y Maribel compraran cerdos para cria. Nieves, Paula y Karina compraran borregos para cria y su venta, Esther comprara becerros para su cria y engorda para su venta, Carmen invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes, Ariana invertirá en bisutería y Felisa comprara guajolotes para cria y venta. El grupo esta muy contento y agradecido con la institución por el crédito otorgado y que para estas mujeres a sido de gran ayuda para mejorar la calidad de vida de nuestros clientes.
texts.en: The “Las Mazahuas” group has worked together for many years with the communal bank and comprises women who have always tried to give their families the best. Their group name was chosen because the mother tongue of many of the women is mazua. One of the members is Claudia, who is 54 and has been married to Francisco for 35 years. Together, they form a family with their 9 children, 3 of which still depend on Claudia and Francisco. Claudia breeds and fattens dairy cows: she buys them as calves, raises them and fattens them up; once they're ready for breeding, they mate with a bull; and when the calf is born, the cow will produce milk. This time Claudia is requesting a loan to buy a cow and cattle feed. Claudia says she started breeding cattle 30 years ago and she initiated this business in order to help out with the household expenses and the education of her children. Claudia comments, "since I was little, I enjoyed watching the birth of calves". Claudia's difficulties are many, like lack of cattle feed that she can't afford to buy in large quantities, and the income she loses when a cow gets sick and dies. Despite all of this, Claudia is enthusiastic and hard working and that's exactly why her goal is to own many dairy cows that will produce big quantities that she can sell to more people, and eventually make cheese with her cows' milk. All of Claudia's earnings would be put toward supporting her daughters who are currently students and who want to finish their professional studies. Each of her daughters has a different dream. The other members of the group also hope to succeed and that's why they're requesting this loan. The loan will be invested in their businesses: Raquel and Maribel will buy pigs for breeding; Nieves, Paula and Karina will buy sheep for breeding and selling; Esther will buy calves for breeding, fattening up and selling; Carmen will invest in her grocery store; Ariana will invest in jewelry; and Felisa will buy turkey for breeding and selling. The group is very happy with and grateful to the communal bank, which has been a big help in improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow and cattle feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer buena y amable, es conviviente con su pareja llamado Nicanor con quien tiene 3 hijos, tiene una casa propia en donde comparte sus días a lado de su pareja y sus hijos quienes son su razón de esfuerzo, trabajo y sacrificio.
El trabajo de Martha consiste en la venta de productos cosméticos y otras mercaderías como ropa y zapatos, estos va de acuerdo a la temporada en que se encuentre. A diario sale en busca de sus clientes quienes en su mayoría son amigos, vecinos y familiares. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 5 años y siempre lo ha hecho sola. Cuando empezó en éste negocio no le fue muy bien porque solamente esperaba que los clientes lleguen a su casa en busca de sus productos, eso no le funcionaba porque no vendía la cantidad que quería, pero con el tiempo aprendió que para tener éxito en este tipo de trabajo tiene que salir en busca de los clientes y tener técnicas de convencimiento para poder vender lo suficiente y obtener buenas ganancias y sobre todo mantenerlos como su vendedora preferida para que más adelante vuelvan a realizarle nuevas compras. Espera seguir trabajando y tener mucho éxito en adelante, ahora tiene muchas ventas y eso significa que tiene mayores ingresos económicos que le ayudan a mejorar las condiciones de vida que quiere ofrecer a su familia. Este es el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, por ello agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito y le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para lograr sus objetivos, está comprometida al pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. 
Con el monto solicitado comprará mercadería conformada por prendas de vestir y algunos cosméticos que necesita para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Martha, who is 31 years old, is a good, friendly woman.  She lives with her partner Nicanor with whom she has 3 children.  She has her own house in which she spends her days alongside her partner and children, who are the reason for her efforts, work and sacrifice.

Martha's work is the sale of cosmetic products and other merchandise like clothing and shoes, which change according to the season of the year.  She goes out each day in search of customers, most of whom are friends, neighbors and acquaintances.  She has been doing this job for 5 years and has always done it by herself.  When she began in this business, it didn't go very well because she was only waiting for customers to arrive at her house in search of her products.  This didn't work because she didn't sell the quantity that they wanted, but in time she learned that to have success in this type of work, she had to go out in search of customers and have convincing techniques in order to be able to sell sufficiently, to obtain good earnings and, above all, to maintain her position as their preferred vendor so that later on they would return to make new purchases from her.

Martha hopes to continue working and to be successful in the future.  Right now she has many sales and this means that she has more income, which helps improve the living conditions that she wants to offer her family.  This is her fifth loan with the MFP institution.  Martha is grateful to the people that make her loan possible and who give her the opportunity to continue working to achieve her objectives.  She promises to make repayments on time and responsibly.

With the loan, she will buy merchandise, including articles of clothing and some cosmetics that she needs to continue her work.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing and cosmetics that she needs to continue her work

loans.name: Marie Bernadette

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont l'age varie entre 21 et 5 ans. Elle possède et gère une petite unité de vente de bois de chauffage et de poisson frais à domicile depuis 8 ans déjà dans un quartier de la ville. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter une bonne quantité de bois de chauffage afin d'éviter la rupture de stock et satisfaire sa clientèle et ses prévisions de résultat. les bénéfices seront réintroduits dans le fond de roulement d'une part et subviendront aux besoins familiaux (éducation, nutrition, logement)
texts.en: Marie is a 42 year old woman, married and mother to 6 children whose age varies between 21 and 5 years old. She owns and manages a little unit where she has been selling firewood and fresh fish from home for 8 years already in a neighborhood of the city. With this loan she would like to buy a good quantity of firewood in order to avoid stock shortages and satisfy her clientèle and her forecasted results. She will reintroduce part of the profits into her working capital and meet her family's needs (education, nutrition, housing).

loans.use: to buy a good quantity of firewood.

loans.name: Abariki Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Nyane est jeune entrepreneur, présidente du groupe d’affaire « Abariki»,  âgée d’environ 28 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans leur petit business.  La cliente est vendeuse de cigarettes. Elle vend également des poissons salés pour  accroitre ses revenus. Il y a  5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  5 cartons cigarette Stella et le reste d’argent sera affecté dans les petits projets de la famille.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique
texts.en: Nyane is a young entrepreneur, president of the group "Abariki."  She is about 28, married, and mother of three children.  She and her husband support their small business and she sells cigarettes.  She also sells salted fish to add to her sales.  She has been in this business for five years.  She started her business with her own funds that she received from her husband.  This loan will help her increase her supply with five cartons of "Stella" cigarettes and the rest of the money will go to small family projects.  Additionally, she wants to grow her enterprise, send her kids to school, and build a house.  She thanks Hekima for their service to the poor who are excluded from traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes

loans.name: Rosaura Aracely

texts.es:
Rosaura, administra una tienda y venta de ropa, tiene 31 años de edad, está soltera y tiene tres hijos, tiene 5, 8 y 12 años los tres estudian en la escuela, ella vive junto a sus padres, tiene tres años de estar atendiendo el negocio (tienda y venta de ropa), trabaja de lunes a sábado.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, aceite, embutidos, granos básicos, tambien comprara blusas, ropa interior, camisas, faldas, esta compra le ayudara para aumentar el negocio.
El objetivo es con la inversión crear mas ventas, mejorar los ingresos, con ello podrá ayudar con mas facilidad a la familia.
texts.en: Rosaura manages a store and sells clothing. She is 31 years old, and a single mother of three children. They are ages 5, 8 and 12, and they study at school. Rosaura lives with her parents, and she has been managing her businesses for three years. She works Monday to Saturday. Rosaura is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise for her business: cooking oil, sausages, basic staples. She also wants to buy blouses, underwear, shirts, skirts. This purchase will help her grow her business. The objective of this investment is to create more sales and increase income, so that she can contribute to the family.

loans.use: purchase cooking oil, cold cuts, staple foods, blouses, underwear, shirts, and skirts.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy de 26 años, es un joven con muchos deseos de superación, comparte una linda vida conyugal con Carmen de 22 años quien acaba de tener un bebe, ambos son poseedores de una vivienda construida a base de madera que sus padres le regalaron con motivo de la unión marital. 
Como único sustento de su hogar se dedica al trabajo en el campo desde hace 4 años, las parcelas que posee fueron una oferta que su padre le hizo por ser un hijo muy trabajador y respetuoso.
En el normal desarrollo de sus actividades, convoca a jornaleros para que lo ayuden en el trabajo, ya que su parcela es amplia. No obstante lo complicado de su  labor, es el transporte por encontrarse en una zona de difícil acceso y solo se llega por camino a trocha. 
Por ello desea contratar jornaleros para el trabajo de quitar la maleza que impiden el normal desarrollo de las plantas de cacao.
Por tanto, éste es su primer crédito con MFP, agradece la oportunidad para cumplir con sus objetivos. Así con el dinero que solicita serán invertidos en contratar jornaleros para sacar la maleza.
texts.en:
Freddy is a 26 year-old man with a desire to succeed. He shares a beautiful married life with 22 year-old Carmen who just had a baby. Together they they own a home made of wood that his parents gave them for a wedding gift.

Their only household income come from his work in the fields. He has four years of experience working the plots of land that were given to him by his father for being a hardworking and responsible son. 

He needs help from other laborers to manage the day-to-day work since his plot is large. However, the work is complicated since it is in a hard to reach area and can only be accessed by a walking trail. For this reason, he is looking for laborers to weed to prevent the normal growth of cacao plants. 

This is his first loan with MFP, and he is grateful for the opportunity to meet his goals. With this loan he will hire laborers to weed his plot.

loans.use: hire laborers

loans.name: Ana Daisy

texts.es:
Ana, se decide por un nuevo préstamo, porque está trabajando bien en su negocio con este aporte, quiere seguir progresando, se comprara plátanos, maíz, salsa, arroz, tomates, cebollas, entre otros productos que sean necesarios para realizar la venta.  
Comenta que el negocio esta prosperando, ha logrado tener ganancias aceptables, el crédito le ayuda de gran manera, ya que le sirvió para comprar medicamentos para el buen control de la salud.
texts.en:
Ana has decided to request a new loan because this type of contribution has helped her business succeed. She wants to keep moving ahead. 

Some of the necessities she will buy in order to sell her products are plantains, corn, salsa, rice, tomatoes and onions. 

She notes that the business is prospering. She has made acceptable profits. The loan helps her in a big way as she was able to buy medicine in order to stay healthy.

loans.use: to buy plantains, corn, salsa, rice, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Akouélé

texts.fr: Jeune mariée de 27 ans, Akouélé est mère de 02 enfants dont 01 scolarisé. Ces derniers sont respectivement âgés de 05 et 02 ans. Son époux est employé à la société FANMILK et elle-même est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale à son domicile. Elle sollicite son premier crédit auprès de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en produits alimentaires. Elle veut épargner ses profits auprès de WAGES et rêve d’agrandir son étalage et d’avoir une condition de vie meilleure.
texts.en: Akouélé is a 27-year-old young wife and mother of 2 children, one of whom goes to school. Her children are 5 and 2 years old, respectively. Her husband works at FAMILK (a Togolese company that produces milk) and she retails groceries from her home. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES to purchase food products.
