She wants to save her profits with WAGES and dreams of enlarging her merchandise display and enjoying a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Maribel De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maribel, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo,  porque considera que la inversión le permite crecer en sus cultivos, se comprara semilla para pipianera, foliar, pagara mano de obra para preparación de tierra, con esto podrá mantener el regadillo.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo una buena producción, con una cosecha aceptable, está emocionada de seguir cultivando, ha cambiado sus circunstancias familiares, ira poco a poco mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maribel decided in favor of a new loan, because she believes the investment will allow her to expand her crop.  She will buy zucchini seeds and leaf fertilizers, and will pay for the labor to prepare the land so that she can maintain irrigated crops.

With the last loan, she had good output with an acceptable harvest.  She is excited to continue farming.  Her family situation has changed, and little by little she will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy zucchini seeds and leaf fertilizer, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana  tiene 44 años de edad es casada, tiene 02  hijos que dependen de ella, se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de venta de ropa y calzado y su venta la realiza de manera ambulante.
Doña Ana vive  en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras y sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de la comunidad.
Doña Ana solicita el préstamo para la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos, blusas, ropa interior, suéter y pantalones corto, para surtir su negocio en esta temporada navideña y   satisfacer la demanda clientes que le han encargado bastante mercadería.
Doña Ana está contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y  con las ganancias que obtenga  de su negocio desea dar una mejor forma de vida a sus hijos.
Doña Ana su sueño es seguir trabajando para poder mejorar su casa y salir adelante con su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old, married and has two children who depend on her.  For the past three years she has been selling clothing and shoes on foot.  Ana lives in San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras, and her customers are her friends and neighbors from the community.

Ana is asking for a loan in order to buy shirts, pants, skirts, dresses, blouses, undergarments, sweaters, and shorts to stock her business for the Christmas season, so that she can satisfy her customers’ demands.  They have requested lots of merchandise from her.

Ana is happy to be able to continue working and wants to provide her family with a better quality of life with the earnings from her business.  Her dream is to continue working so that she can get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marta, ha trabajado con préstamos, porque considera que son una alternativa para hacer crecer en negocio y poder cubrir la demanda, ella solicita un nuevo financiamiento para la copra de frutas frescas de temporada, pepino, papaya, mangos, jocotes, que son los que sale a vender.
Marta manifiesta que ha mejorado las ventas, se ha mantenido vendiendo todos los días, lo que le ha ocasionado tener ingresos para los gastos de la familia, este negocio le sirve para la subsistencia.
texts.en: Marta has worked with loans because she considers them to be a way to grow a business and meet demand. She is requesting a new loan to purchase fresh seasonal fruits and vegetables, such as cucumber, papaya, mangoes and plums, to sell. She says that her sales have increased and she has been selling every day, which has provided income for family expenses. The business is her sustenance.

loans.use: to purchase cucumber, papaya, mangoes and plums.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: La socia  es la señora  Luisa, ella pertenece al banco “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.  La socia continúa con su actividad de comercio de productos de belleza.  Luisa como en oportunidades anteriores está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como maquillaje, perfumería y cosméticos en general. Luisa está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar con su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Luisa belongs to the "Los Lideres" bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. She continues to work selling beauty products. As on previous occasions, Luisa is applying for the loan to buy merchandise like makeup, perfume, and cosmetics in general. Luisa is very grateful to KIVA for allowing her to continue her work, which is the the main economic income and means of support of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like makeup, perfume, and cosmetics in general

loans.name: Vilma Gladys

texts.es:
Vilma, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para seguir trabajando con la granja de cerdos, se compra tres para esta temporada, que le permitan tener disponibles, engordarlos y revenderlo, este préstamo suplirá una necesidad de inversión que tiene Vilma.
Con el préstamo anterior considera que su efecto fue positivo, teniendo mejores ingresos, cambiando algunas condiciones en su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma is asking for a new loan so that she can continue to work her pig farm.  She will buy three pigs this season, so that she can have some on hand, fatten them up, and resell them.  This loan will supplement the necessary investment that Vilma will make.

She believes that the previous loan had a positive effect and brought her a better income and improving some of her family’s conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Washington

texts.es:
El socio es el señor  Washington,  él continúa con su actividad económica prestando servicio de transporte urbano público. Washington como en anteriores oportunidades y para mantenerse en su actividad, está solicitando un préstamo para comprar repuestos y accesorios para dar mantenimiento a su vehículo.  Washington agradece a  KIVA por permitirle seguir trabajando y desarrollándose en su actividad económica.
Washington pertenece al banco “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú
texts.en:
This member is named Washington.  He continues with his economic activity offering the service of urban public transportation.  Washington, like in previous opportunities and in order to continue in his activity, is asking for a loan to buy parts and accessories for the maintenance of his vehicle.  Washington is grateful to KIVA for allowing him to continue working and developing his economic activity.

Washington belongs to the communal bank "Los Lideres" in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy parts and accessories for the maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita, she previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Juanita hopes to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of cloth, needles, and other materials needed in her tailoring business

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
This is Cresencia, 43, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a butcher, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cresencia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Cresencia hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. Marlyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marlyn requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, can goods, spices, etc.

Marlyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, can goods, spices, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, 40 and resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Junie and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Gina hopes to expand her business and dreams to give her children a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Дилафруз является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Дилафруз  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес  купле продажей  продуктов питания.  От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Difficult life circumstances force people to gather up their strength and galvanize the resources they have on hand. Dilafruz is one such person who is trying to improve her living conditions and stimulate the economic situation of her family. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband earns a small salary that is not sufficient to provide for all the family's needs, so Dilafruz has decided to help him for the welfare of the family. To this end, she took a course entitled "Get Ahead" that was organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and for which she earned a certificate. She now wants to start a business selling food items. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to provide her children with a good education and nutritious food. Dilafruz is seeking a loan of 2,000 Tajikistan Somoni to buy inventory to set up her new business. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy food items to set up a new business

loans.name: Jamileth

texts.es:
La señora Jamileth  es originaria de la Comarca las Tunitas, Teustepe, de oficio comerciante en es dueña de pulpería, acompañada, madre de dos hijos de 1 y 15 años. Inicio su negocio con ahorros que tenia reforzó sus ventas invirtiendo en productos básicos para el negocio, después con esfuerzo propio y la ayuda de su padrastro que la apoyaba, estableció su negocio en su domicilio, compro un frízer para mantener sus productos fresco y vitrinas para exhibir su mercadería. En su negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposo que le ayuda con la administración de la pulpería. 
Su expectativa es crecer más  en mercadería para su negocio  con el objetivo de aumentar sus ventas. Requiere el préstamo para la compra de productos como azúcar, arroz, jabón, aceite , pasta de dientes, papel higiénico etc. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara porque podrá surtir su pulpería con productos mas solicitados por los clientes, sus planes futuros es construir una casa para  sus hijos, su  meta es seguir trabajando en su negocio, obtener mas ganancias, cancelar el préstamo y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Jamileth is originally from the community of Las Tunitas in the Teustepe region. She is a businesswoman, the owner of a grocery store. She is married, and she is the mother of two children, ages 1 and 15. She began her business with savings that she had, and she strengthened her sales, investing in basic products for the business. Later, with her own effort and the help of her stepfather, who was helping her, she established her business in her home. She bought a freezer to keep her products fresh and display cases to exhibit her merchandise. In her business she has the support of her husband, who helps her with the administration of the grocery store.

Her expectation is to expand the merchandise for her business more, with the goal of increasing her sales. She needs the loan to purchase products such as sugar, rice, soap, toothpaste, toilet paper, etc. She thinks that this loan will help her because she will be able to stock her grocery store with the products most requested by her customers. Her future plan is to build a house for her children. Her goal is to continue working in her business, obtain more earnings, pay off the loan, and be able to advance with her family.

loans.use: to buy products such as sugar, rice, soap, oil, toothpaste, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Godinez Group

texts.es:
La señora Asucena esta casad, tiene 60 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria, la crianza de animales, como vacas, toros, cerdos y pollos, inicio este negocio criando pollos ponedoras y hasta ahora lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara principalmente para la compra de cerdos y toros, espera seguir mejorando y contar con una granja. Las demás integrantes s4e dedican al comercio, venta de ropa y la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Asucena, 60, is married with 6 children who study. She didn't get the opportunity to go to school. She is a farmer and breeds animals, like cows, bulls, pigs and chickens. She started her business rearing chickens and now has 10 years of experience. Her husband is in commerce and she counts on his support 

She organized the group in order to request a loan. She'll use the loan primarily to buy pigs and bulls. She hopes to expand her business into a farmhouse. The other members work in commerce, clothing sales and animal breeding.

loans.use: buy animals for breeding.

loans.name: Rosa Lidya

texts.es:
Rosa, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de mercadería para la tienda y la compra de semilla de marañón, que serán de mucha importancia para mantenerse en el negocio, además surtirá la tienda de aceite, detergentes, boquitas, a parte de la compra de una bomba de agua para el pozo.
Ella tuvo una experiencia positiva con el préstamo anterior, le mejoro el numero de clientes, sus ventas han aumentado, con esto ha logrado cubrir los gastos en la familia, también compro un molino de nixtamal para prestar un nuevo servicio y generar ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa has decided to apply for a new loan to buy merchandise for the store as well as cashew nuts, which will be very important to stay in business.  She will also stock the store with oil, detergents and snacks, as well as buy a water pump for the well.

She had a positive experience with the last loan.  Her customers increased and her sales improved, allowing her to cover family costs.  She also bought a corn mill to offer a new service and generate income.

loans.use: To buy oil, detergents, snacks and a water pump for the well.

loans.name: Hokimoy

texts.ru: Хокимой умница и целеустремленная девушка. Ей 21 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями и братом. Она очень любит ухаживать за скотом и поэтому решила перевоплощать хобию в бизнес.  С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес  купле продажей  скота.  Она запрашивает займ на сумму  500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Hokimoy is a clever and purposeful young woman.  She's twenty one years old.  She's not married and lives with her parents and brother.  She loves to care for animals and has decided to develop her hobby into a business.  With this goal in mind, she took the course "Bring it On", organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate.  Now, she has the opportunity to organize her business and become successful in her industry. She'd like to form a business selling animals.  She's asking for the sum of 500 somoni to buy animals to organize this new business.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to organize a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, and also sandals and flip-flops.

loans.name: Mujeres Obreras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES OBRERAS”  iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maruja es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pan de laja, venta de accesorios de celulares, tejido de chompas, venta de mantas, comercio de frutas, venta de antenas, trabajo en empresa de limpieza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Maruja es parte integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de unas amigas que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de antenas, este negocio lo emprendió paso a paso  con el poco capital que tenía y que en la actualidad quiere aumentar por ser fin de año.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de antenas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “MUJERES OBRERAS” community association will begin its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes Center.  This group is made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors where Maruja serves as president.

The members have various types of businesses, including: sales of slab bread, cell phone accessory sales, knitting sweaters, blanket sales, fruit sales, and cleaning services.

They will use the money from this loan to help their small companies.  Maruja tells us that she started with Pro Mujer two years ago, after some of her friends invited her to join.  She sells antennas and started this business little by little with little capital.  Now she wants to expand for the end of the year season.

She will use the money to increase her capital (buy antennas) that she will acquire at fairs in the city of El Alto.  She will resell them from her stall.  This type of work allows her to generate income to help support her household; she lives with her husband and three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health benefits.

loans.use: to buy antennas.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
El socio es el señor  Narciso,  él continúa dedicándose a la artesanía, principalmente elaborando bordados para elementos de imaginería religiosa. Narciso como en anteriores oportunidades y para mantenerse en su actividad, está solicitando un préstamo para comprar materiales de pasamanería como telas, encajes, hilos de colores y accesorios.  Narciso agradece a  KIVA por permitirle seguir trabajando y desarrollándose en su actividad económica.
Narciso pertenece al banco “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú
texts.en:
Narciso is an artisan who does embroidery work, primarily for religious articles.  Narciso had a previous loan and to continue his work, he is looking for a new loan to buy trimmings like thread, lace, colored thread and accessories. Narciso thanks a  KIVA for allowing him to continue working and developing his business.

Narciso belongs to the village bank "Los Lideras" (The Leaders) in the city of Cusco in Peru.

loans.use: Buy fabrics, lace, colored threads and acessories

loans.name: La Hermosa Group

texts.es:
La señora Ingar Domenica es casada, tiene 33 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la producción de pantalones y blusas, inició este negocio con una pequeña maquina de costura, y hasta ahora  lleva 16 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que  los utilizara para la compra de telas de diferentes clase ya que quiere incrementar su producción de pantalones y blusas, espera en el futuro tener una maquila. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a servicios de trasporte, albañilería, confección de delantales, blusas y faldas, maestro de música y a la artesanía.
texts.en:
Ingar Domenica is married.  She is 33 years old and finished 6 years of primary education.  She has 4 children who are students.  She is dedicated to the production of pants and blouses.  She began this business with a small sewing machine and now has 16 years of experience.  She relies on the support of her husband who works in clothing sales.

Ingar organized a group to be able to request a loan, which will be used to buy cloth of different types since she wants to increase her production of pants and blouses.  She hopes in the future to have a shop.  The other members of the group are dedicated to services such as transportation, bricklaying, making aprons, blouses and skirts, teaching music and artisan crafts.

loans.use: to buy fabric for aprons

loans.name: Lecia Araceli

texts.es:
La señora Lecia tiene 41 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive  con  su  esposo  y sus  4   hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca al sur de Honduras.
Doña Lecia dedica a la venta  de  gallinas y cerdos y necesita el  préstamo para la compra de gallinas y cerdos, para poder tener más producto que ofrecer y cubrir los pedidos que a diario le exigen sus clientes.
Doña Lecia con los ingresos obtenidos desea mejorar un poco su situación económica  y la de su familia. En el futuro ella espera que su negocio crezca y  al  mismo  tiempo  espera que sus hijos terminen  sus estudios  y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.

Choluteca, Honduras  –  Noviembre del  2012
texts.en: Lecia, 41, is a very responsible, honest, and hard working person. She lives with her husband and her four children in a community in the Choluteca province in southern Honduras. Lecia sells hens and hogs and needs a loan to buy more livestock so she can offer more products and meet her clients' daily needs. With the new income, Lecia hopes to improve her and her family's economic situation a little. In the future, she hopes that her business grows and that her children finish their education and become good people with better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy hens and hogs for her business.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: La socia  es la señora  Maritza, ella pertenece al banco “AMAUTA” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.  La socia continúa dedicándose a la elaboración de prendas de vestir tejidas como chompas y también a la compra y venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, Maritza como en oportunidades anteriores está solicitando el préstamo para comprar material como lanas y mercadería como casacas, pantalones, polos etc.  y capitalizar su actividad para la próxima campaña navideña. Maritza está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar con su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en: This communal bank member is Señora Maritza. She belongs to the communal bank "Amauta" in the city of Cusco, Peru. She continues making knitted articles of clothing such as sweaters, and she also buys and sells clothing for women, men, and children. Maritza, as in the past, is applying for the loan to buy material such as wool and merchandise such as jackets, pants, polo shirts, etc., to capitalize her business for the coming Christmas season. Maritza is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue with her business, which represents the principal economic income and sustenance of her family.

loans.use: to buy wool and merchandise such as jackets, pants, and polo shirts.

loans.name: Batireedui

texts.en: Mr. Batireedui is 29 years old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  The family's only income source is Batireedui’s job in construction enterprise.  He is quite adept at his job as a crane operator.  To improve their living standard, the couple wants to buy a car as a source of extra income.  So far, the couple has accumulated 1,700,000 MNT, but the actual price of the car is 8,500,000 MNT.  So, he is requesting a 6,800,000 MNT loan.  The car they want to purchase has an electric engine which is environmentally friendly, and pollutes the air less than other automobiles.  By taking out this loan, this young family can buy their car and contribute to their household income.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, tiene 27 años de edad, esta viviendo con su esposo y dos hijos, ella ayuda a su esposo con las actividades de agricultura y ganadería, ella comercializa la leche que dan las vacas, trabaja todos los días junto a su pareja.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprarse concentrado para el ganado y tambien insumos como el abono para realizar el cultivo de pipián, con este préstamo Reina estará ayudando a mejorar el negocio, con lo necesario.
La aspiración de Reina es  ofrecer a su familia una mejor condición, a sus hijos educarlos para que puedan tener mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Reina is 27 years old, and she is living with her spouse and two children. She helps her husband with farming and cattle, and she sells the milk that the cows make. She and her husband work every day. 

She’s asking for a loan to buy feed for the livestock and supplies like fertilizer to reap the squash harvest. With this loan, Reina will help improve her business.

Reina’s aspiration is to offer her family the best life and to educate her sons so that they can have better opportunities.

loans.use: purchase feed for the livestock and fertilizer to plant squash.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: La socia  es la señora  María Ines, ella pertenece al banco “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.  La socia continúa con su actividad en la venta de alimentos y bebidas en su restaurante.  María Ines como en oportunidades anteriores está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos para cocina como arroz, carnes, verduras, menestras y bebidas. María Ines está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar con su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Maria Ines is a member of the communal bank “Los Lideres” in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She is continuing with her business selling food and beverages in her restaurant. Maria Ines, like in previous loans, is asking to borrow in order to buy supplies for her restaurant including rice, meat, vegetables, beans, and drinks. Maria  Ines is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue her economic activity which represents the primary income and sustenance for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, vegetables, beans and drinks

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es: La socia  es la señora  Luz Estela, ella pertenece al banco “AMAUTA” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.  La socia continúa dedicándose al comercio de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Luz Estela como en oportunidades anteriores está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como casacas, pantalones, polos etc.  y capitalizar su actividad para la próxima campaña navideña. Luz Estela está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar con su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Ms. Luz Estela belongs to the communal bank "Amauta" in the city of Cusco, Peru. She sells clothes for women, men and children. Luz Estela just like her previous loan, is looking to buy merchandise like jackets, pants, shirts and more, and would like to capitalize on the activity from the coming holiday season.  Luz Estela is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue her work that is the primary income and livelihood for her family.

loans.use: Buy merchandise like jackets, pants, shirts and more.

loans.name: Germilita

texts.en:
Germilita is 44 years old, married and has seven children. She is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Germilita requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Germilita has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for his food/retail shop.

loans.name: Haidilita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Haidilita works hard to support her family.
She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling frozen products. Haidilita is borrowing PHP 18,500 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, soft drinks, eggs, and soap for her general store business.
Haidilita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, soft drinks, eggs, and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more gasoline to resell

loans.name: Azizahon

texts.ru: Азизахон женщина в возрасте  46 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Занимается торговлей детской одежды. Опыт в этой сфере деятельности около 14 лет. Азизахон впервые кредитуется в нашей организации. Она услышала от своих соседей по бизнесу, что можно получить кредит на увеличение товарооборота и сразу же подала заявку. Супруг Азизахон развозит строительные материалы.  Занимается перевозкой таких строительных материалов как: песок, щебень, цементный блок, уголь и т.д. Он всячески помогает и поддерживает супругу. Они общими усилиям выдали старшую дочь за муж и женили сына. Азизахон на полученный кредит хочет закупить новый ассортимент детской одежды и  увеличить свой товарооборот. Увеличив товарооборот она хочет получить побольше прибыли и откладывать деньги на будущее своего младшего сына. Азизахон с супругом благодарны нашей организации за финансовую помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Azizahon is 46 years old, married, and has 3 children. She sells children's clothing, and has around 14 years of experience working in this field. This is the first time she has come to Arvand for a loan. She heard from her neighbours at her business that it is possible to get a loan from our organization to increase her turnover, and she immediately submitted an application. Her husband works transporting construction materials such as sand, stone, cement blocks, coal, and so on. He helps and supports his wife in every way he can. They worked together to host the weddings of both their son and their daughter. Azizahon plans to use the loan to buy a new assortment of children's clothing so she can increase her turnover, thereby earning more profit which will allow her to save money for her youngest son's future. Azizahon and her husband are grateful to our organization for the financial help and support.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Lydia requested a loan of 29500 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials for her business. Lydia has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Uno Group

texts.es:
La señora Isabel esta casada, tiene 40 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando, se dedica a la sastrería, inicio este trabajo siendo operaria con una vecina, hasta el momento lleva 18 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo de confección.

Organiza un grupo para poder aumentar su capital de trabajo y producción de camisas en sus diferentes tamaños, ya que va comprar telas de diferente colores, esperan en el futuro tener trabajadores y tener una maquiladora. Los demás integrantes se dedican a la sastrería.
texts.en:
Isabel is married, 40 years old, studied 3 years of primary school, and has 7 children of whom 3 are studying. She is a tailor and started this work being a worker with a neighbor. Up to this time she has 18 years of experience. She counts on the support of her husband who is in the same work of dressmaking.

She is organizing a group in order to be able to increase her working capital and production of shirts in different sizes, since she is going to buy fabric of different colors. They hope in the future to have workers and have an assembly plant. The other members are also tailors.

loans.use: to buy fabric for shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizers

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen un hijo de tres años de edad. Su esposo es ebanista.

Doña María realiza el crédito para que el esposo lo utilice en su negocio, el cual tiene un taller de ebanistería en su casa donde realizan muchos trabajos a base de madera como muebles, sillas, puertas, camas, entre otras cosas, el trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00 y en ocasiones hasta los domingos cuando tiene alguna obra por entregar. Realiza trabajos para personas que llegan hasta su establecimiento y también entrega en Manta y Portoviejo en algunos  almacenes de esas ciudades. La madera la compra en un depósito de madera en Manta donde encuentra la madera que necesita para elaborar obras de muy buena calidad.

Este crédito lo van a emplear para comprar madera, pintura, selladores y otros materiales para la elaboración de sus obras. Está en el Banco Comunal hace  más de 8 años y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que ofrece la institución. 

Sus sueños son tener su casa bien construida y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
The La Sequita communal bank meets every two weeks in the Sequita parrish, part of the Montecristi Prospero settlement, full of hardworking, dedicated people proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parrish where its inhabitants are honest people who only know how to work and be devoted to their families.

Maria lives here.  She is 25 years old, married, and has a three year old son.  Her husband works as a cabinetmaker.

Maria is asking for this loan so that her husband can use it in his business.  He has a cabinet workshop at home, where he does a lot of woodworking and makes furniture, chairs, doors, beds, and other things.  He works Monday through Saturday from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm and sometimes on Sundays when he has orders to deliver.  He does jobs for people who visit his establishment and also delivers to warehouses in Manta and Portoviejo.  He buys the lumber from a lumberyard in Manta, where he finds quality lumber for quality work.

The money from this loan will be used to buy lumber, paint, sealants, and other supplies for his work.  [Maria] has been with the communal bank for more than eight years and she likes the additional benefits offered by the institution.

Her dreams are to have a well-built house and to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her food/retail shop.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and her personal, household, and business expenditures. 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 
Nida dreams of being able to give all her children a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 20 años, es una joven mujer, amable y muy trabajadora, es soltera y hasta el momento no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, ella junto a su familia trabajan mucho para así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
La actividad que realiza Luz es la venta de comidas típicas de la zona y asados de carnes como pollo, cerdo y pescado, para ello instala su mesa en el frontis de su casa, desde ahí atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Lleva en este negocio desde hace 3 años y cuenta con la ayuda de su madre para la preparación de los potajes y la atención de los clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y transeúntes. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y la necesidades de  su pequeño hijo quien es la motivación para seguir progresando, por lo contrario no le gusta cuando los precios de su insumos suben reduciendo sus ganancias pero aun así logra encontrar la rentabilidad en sus ventas, tiene planes de seguir con su negocio y mantenerlo, ampliando con mejores sillas y mesas para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este es el préstamo número 4 con MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando para seguir con su negocio y avanzar con sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles comprará todos los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas tales como arroz, aceites, papas y demás.
texts.en:
Luz, 20, is a kind and very hardworking young woman.  She's single and has no children yet.  She lives in her parents' house.  She and her family work a lot to have a better quality of life.

Luz's job is selling traditional regional food and grilled meat such as chicken, pork, and fish, for which she sets up her table in front of her house, where she waits on her customers kindly and cordially.  She has had this business for three years and has her mother's help in preparing the soups and waiting on customers, who are mainly her neighbors and passersby.

She likes her business because it allows her to have an income to be able to pay for the household expenses and the needs of her young son, who is her motivation for continuing to make progress.  On the contrary, she doesn't like when the prices of her supplies increase, reducing her profits.  But even then she manages to find profitability in her sales.  She plans to continue with her business and maintain it, expanding with better chairs and tables so her customers will be more comfortable.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She's grateful for their financial support to get ahead with her business and move forward with her plans.

With the requested amount of 3000 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll buy all the ingredients she needs to make her dishes, including rice, oil, potatoes, and others.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, potatoes and other ingredients

loans.name: Yunguyo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YUNGUYO”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosalia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de tullmas, tejido de chompas, tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, elaboración de repostería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Rosalía es parte integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección de chompas, cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió de su madre quien tejía en su domicilio y paso a paso  fue implementando su propio microempresa de tejido.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará por docena a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y compartir.
texts.en:
The YUNGUYO group is entering its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer [Kiva field partner], as a part of the Focus Center of the Andes. The group is made up of eight women led by an executive council of which Rosalía is President. The members' businesses are varied, including selling knit hair beads, knit sweaters, and running a corner store and a confectionery. 

The loan they're taking out will benefit a variety of small businesses, including the one that Rosalía is a part of. She tells us that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, becoming interested through a representative who came to visit her at home. Currently, she weaves sweaters, which she says she learned to make from her mother who used to knit at home, slowly but surely building her own small weaving business. 

The loan she's taking out now is to increase her working capital by buying wool from the markets in the city of El Alto. After production, she sells her sweaters by the dozen. This line of work allows her to support her home as much as she can, as she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said she likes the savings and group lending.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena de cuarenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; ella posee una panadería y vende pan el variedad francés y dulce,  quesadillas, salpores, pastelitos, tortas entre otros, es muy conocida en la zona pues elabora el pan más exquisito del lugar, el rico aroma que se siente cuando el pan está recién hecho atrae mucha clientela y se siente muy satisfecha al ver que las personas se van satisfechas del lugar, todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente, María es una mujer visionaria con muchas ganas de ganarse un futuro más próspero, piensa que si tiene un comienzo tendrá la lucha y si tiene la lucha lograra la victoria, ahora está buscando la lucha y quiere acrecentar el negocio pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor,  manteca, jaleas, azúcar, sal, bandejas, etc. María Magdalena  es muy responsable y con un buen record crediticio tiene confianza que podrá saldar la deuda pero sobre todo tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Magdalena is 41 years old and lives with her life partner and her children in their own home. She owns a bakery and sells French and sweet bread, "quesadillas" [flour or corn tortillas with cheese], "salpores", pastries, and cakes, among others. She is very known in the area because she makes the finest bread. 

The good aroma that one can smell when the bread is fresh attracts many customers. She feels very pleased to see that people leave the place satisfied. 
Everything she sells is of top quality and at an affordable price. Moreover, the service is excellent.   

María is a visionary woman eager to achieve a brighter future. She thinks that a start will allow her to fight, and with a fight she will be able to achieve a victory. She is currently looking for this fight and she wants to expand her business but she needs capital. That's why she is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL, so she can buy flour in bulk, butter, jelly, sugar, salt, trays, etc.

María Magdalena is very responsible and has a very good credit record. She has confidence that she will be able to pay back the debt but above all, she has faith that she will be able to provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk, butter, jelly, sugar, salt, and trays.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
This is Carolina. She previously utilized a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase additional quantity and variety of grocery items and products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Carolina hopes to give her child a good high quality education. She wants to have a deeper relationship with the Lord. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps a lot in learning from the Bible. Before becoming a member of CCT, Carolina never opened her Bible, but she does now as it strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо обратилась в МДО «Арванд» для получения кредита чтобы  купить квартиру .    Она живет со своими  родителями, так же с ними живет ее брат с семьей.  По стечению обстоятельств Мархабо  развелась с мужем  8 лет назад и с двумя детьми осталась без крова и поддержки.   В течении восьми лет она копит деньги,  у нее есть небольшая лавка , где она готовит пирожки и продает.  Но чтобы купить квартиру ей немного не хватает денег поэтому она просит кредит.  Ее родители пенсионеры, и от них   Мархабо не ждет помощи.    На фотографии она в той квартире которую хочет купить.  Она очень рада,  что можно обратиться в Арванд и получить  кредит на долгосрочный период и осуществить долгожданную мечту.
texts.en:
Marhabo has contacted MDO Arvand to receive a loan to buy an apartment.  She currently lives with her parents, her brother and her brother's family.  

She and her husband divorced eight years ago and, due to a combination of circumstances, Marhabo and her two children were left without any shelter or support.  For the past eight years, Marhabo has been saving some money and running a little shop where she prepares and sells "pirozhki" (baked or fried buns).  However, she doesn't have quite enough money to buy an apartment, and this is why she is asking for a loan.  Her parents are both retired, and she cannot expect them to help her. 

The photo is taken in the apartment that Marhabo would like to buy.  She is very happy that she could turn to MDO Arvand and receive a long-term loan, which will make her long-awaited dream come true.

loans.use: to buy an apartment.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 60 years old, married, with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marina has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Marina requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Marina has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Marina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 49 years old and has six children. Thelma is married and has 2 children who are in school.

Thelma is in the agricultural business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 16500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Thelma has been buying and selling livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel tiene 45 años de edad, comparte una vida conyugal con Marina de 46 años, y juntos tienen 4 hijos, habitando en una vivienda hecha con madera.
Posee una parcelam en donde produce cacao orgánico, actividad que ejerce hace 10 años, pues anteriormente en ese lugar criaba reses, pero le era muy difícil debido a que se perdía sus animales y eso no le convenía. Es así que ópto por la siembra de cacao,  debido a que la tierra es muy fertil y crece sin problema alguno. 
Es uno de los pioneros en el uso de guano de isla en su zona debido a que después de su primera prueba obtuvo una calidad formidable de mazorcas cacaoteras logrando así motivar a otros productores al uso masivo de este producto.
Como parte de una ampliación de siembra, desea adquirir una cantidad considerable de abono orgánico para garantizar una producción de calidad, así mismo contratar jornaleros para el injerto de 600 plantas de cacao y así aplicar una producción tecnificada con el objetivo de incrementar sus ganancias.
Este es su crédito número 8, se siente muy confiado y agradecido ya que considera es una herramienta indispensable para el trabajo productivo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de sacos de abono orgánico, asimismo contratará jornaleros para la implementación de injertos de cacao.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 45 years old, and he shares his married life with Marina who is 36 years old. Together they have 4 children, and they are living in wooden house. 
Gabriel owns a piece of land where he grows organic cacao, a business he’s been doing for ten years. Previously, he was raising cattle, but it was very difficult, and they lost their animals. It wasn’t good for Gabriel. So he decided to harvest cacao since the land is very fertile and grows without a problem. Gabriel is one of the pioneers in his region for using guano from the island, because he received a tremendous quality of pods after trying it out for the first time. This managed to encourage other producers to use the product. 
As part of enlarging his planting, he wants to get a considerable amount of organic fertilizer in order to guarantee a quality harvest. He also wants to hire laborers to graft 600 cocoa plants, and employ a systematic technique with the goal of increasing his earnings.
With his credit number of 8, Gabriel feels very confident and grateful since he believes it’s an indispensable tool for productive work. With the 1,000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency), he will buy bags of organic fertilizer and hire laborers to do the cacao planting.

loans.use: buy organic fertlizer and hire laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 40 years old and married with three children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, and soap.

Rosalinda has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for four years, and also earns an income from buying and selling gasoline.

Rosalinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store like soft drinks, can goods, noodles, and soap.

loans.name: Dycel

texts.en:
Dycel is 23 years old, married and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Dycel runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for four years.  She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock, such as biscuits, spices, sugar and coffee, to sell in her general store.

In the future Dycel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, such as biscuits, spices, sugar and coffee, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал, родился в 1985 года. В сельской местности. Женат и имеет 2 детей. Супруга Акмала не имеет высшего образования. Она занимается воспитанием своих  маленьких детей.  Кроме супруги и детей с ними живут его родители, они пенсионеры. Акмал занимается перевозкой людей (такси) по городу. Он единственный кормилец в семье. Акмал получает  кредит чтобы подготовить  свою машину в зимний период и заменить шины. Он выражает свою благодарность  "Арванд"  за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Akmal was born in the countryside in 1985.  He is married and has two children.  His wife does not have a higher education and she takes care of their young children.  In addition to his wife and children, Akmal also lives with his parents, who are retired.

Akmal works as a taxi driver, in town.  He is the only breadwinner in the family.  He is getting a loan to prepare his car for the winter and to replace his tires.  He is very grateful for the financial support provided by MDO Arvand.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products from AVON to resell.

loans.name: Aldrin

texts.en:
Aldrin, from Ubay, Bohol, is a 40-year-old married man and a father of three young children. He has been engaged in rice farming for more than 20 years. This is his source of income.

Aldrin is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to grow and harvest healthy crops.
In the future, Aldrin aims to expand his farming business and to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and food vending. Emma is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her general store such as eggs, shampoo, soap, coffee, and canned goods.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock such as eggs, shampoo, soap, coffee, and canned goods, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres earns a living through his rice farming business. He has been in the business for more than ten years. Andres works hard to support his family, especially for the schooling of his three children.

Andres is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer to improve his farming business. 

In the future, Andres aims to expand his business so that it will generate more income to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his rice farm.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell.

Leonisa has been in this business for seven years. She earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and coconut wine.

Leonisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textiles to make school and office uniforms.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Violeta is borrowing PHP 1800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Violeta is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Antonita

texts.en:
Antonieta and her husband have earned a living through their fishing business for more than 20 years. This is the source of their income.

Antonieta is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. Through this equipment, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch and give them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Antonieta hopes to expand their fishing business so that it will augment their income. Moreover, she wants to continually send her children to school to improve their learning and to allow them to have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Sasagara Group

texts.fr:
Pascasie fait partie du groupe Sasagara et  habite à  Gitega. Elle  60 ans et est mariée à  Pascal, un commerçant de manioc. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants.

Elle  fait le  commerce  de  bananes et de farine de manioc  depuis 5 ans. 

Elle est à son dixième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   une grande quantité de farine de manioc et de  bananes, à revendre,  pour gagner plus. 

Avec le gain de son commerce, elle  nourrit et habille sa famille.
texts.en:
Pascasie is part of the  group Sasagara and lives in Gitega. She is 60 years old and married to Pascal, a cassava merchant. Together they have two children.

Pascasie has been doing commerce in bananas and cassava flour for five years. 

She is on her tenth loan with the microfinance institution Turame. With this KIVA loan she is obtaining, she will increase her capital and purchase a large amount of cassava flour and bananas to resell, so as to earn more.

With the profits from her commerce, she feeds and clothes her family.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of cassava flour and bananas to resell

loans.name: Ma. Aida

texts.en:
Ma. Aida is a 38-year-old married woman with seven children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Aida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years. Ma. Aida requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

In the future, Ma. Aida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 55 years old, is married and has 10 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell.

In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta lives in the town of Artashat with her 18-year-old daughter Lusine, who studies Finance and Credit at the Yerevan "Gladzor" University. 

To earn a living, Marieta teaches the Russian language at home. This is the only source of income for the two. It is very difficult for Marieta to cover basic needs while paying for the education of her daughter. Marieta has applied for this loan to pay for tuition of her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa is 57 years old, is married and has six children.

Nicolasa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks, such as soap, shampoo, sugar, cream and canned goods, to sell in her general store.

Nicolasa has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns income from raising livestock.

Nicolasa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of goods, such as soap, shampoo, sugar, cream and canned goods, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar and vinegar to make more "Fruit Murabah" to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Mariée à un comptable, Marie est quand à elle revendeuse de sacs et d’habits. Elle est âgée de 40 ans et est mère de 05 enfants dont 04 scolarisés. Son ainé a 23 ans et le dernier a 11 ans. Elle dispose d’une boutique depuis l’an 2000 et se fait aider par 02 employées. Elle sollicite son premier crédit auprès de WAGES pour l‘achat des sacs et des habits afin de satisfaire la demande de ses clients en cette fin d’année. Ses profits seront destinés au réinvestissement dans son activité. Elle veut augmenter la taille de sa boutique et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Married to an accountant, Marie herself is a retailer of handbags and clothing. She is 40 years old and the  mother of five children, of whom four are in school. Her eldest is 23 years old, and the last is 11. Marie has had a shop since 2000 and is assisted by two employees. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to purchase handbags and clothing for satisfying the demands of her customers for the year's end. Her profits will be used for reinvesting in her business. She wants to increase the size of her shop and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase handbags and clothing to sell

loans.name: Susima

texts.en:
Susima works hard to support her family. Susima is married and has had a food vending business in the Philippines for five years.

Susima requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

In the future, Susima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Puka Pukayoc  De Pachar Group

texts.es:
La señora Brígida vive en la comunidad de Pachar, tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y fruto de unión tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal de señora Brígida es la agricultura y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Brígida requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento para sus cuyes (Forraje, pasto y alimentos suplementarios).  
 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Las socias que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía llego tarde a la reunión del banco comunal).

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brígida lives in the Pachar neighborhood; she is 48 years old, is married and has four children out of the marriage. Her main source of income comes from agriculture and in breeding small animals like cuyes (a type of guinea pig) and chickens. She has had her business for several years since she does quite well. Brígida needs a loan to buy feed for her cuyes (fodder, grass and supplementary feed).

The members are grateful for the opportunity given to them and are committed to meeting all the payment quotas in the established time frames. (The members that appear in the lower part of the picture were late to the communal banks’ meeting).

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco, department of Cusco right in the heart of the ancient city of the Incas and is characterized for being a tourist area for its archeological sites, its historical hub, its landscapes, history and generally being an enchanting city in the southern part of the country. Cusco is known for being an area for tourism, business, its traditional celebration, Inti Raymi and because it is one of the Seven Wonders of the World, “Machupicchu.”

loans.use: buy food for her cuyes.

loans.name: Fareeda's Group

texts.en:
Ms. Fareeda is 41 years old, and a very hardworking, active woman. Since 2008 she has been running her own general store in the remote area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a taxi driver and their son is an intermediate student. Her son is a responsible person and wants to open a new mobile shop in the future.

Fareeda wants to help her general store grow by purchasing a variety of products to sell, like soap, shampoos, flour, rice and sugar so that she can increase her net income and savings and satisfy her clients more efficiently. 

To do that, as a member of a 2-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the profits amount she earns, she wishes to help her son to open a new mobile shop. Fareeda dreams of the bright and successful future of her son. Best wishes for KIVA and BRAC Pakistan from her.

Note: In the picture Fareeda holds a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products, like soap, shampoos, flour, rice, and sugar for her general store.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Celina has been in this business for 10 years now and works hard to support her family.

Celina requested a PHP18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional vegetables to sell. In the future, Celina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a business of buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Josephine is borrowing PHP28,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Yina Esperanza

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal La Nueva California.

En este lugar vive la señora Yina, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo tres hijos de 21, 19 y 15 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian los dos mayores en  Universidad y el menor en colegio lo cual representan un gasto muy grande para ellos. Su marido trabaja en un taller de torno.

Doña Yina se dedica al comercio, en un principio solo vendía  ropa, pero después y con la ayuda de los créditos fue aumentando su mercadería y ahora también vende zapatos, carteras y bisutería con lo cual sus ganancias han aumentado mucho mas,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale en sus ratos libres a visitar a sus clientes, toma los pedidos y luego los fines de semana cobra lo que ha entregado ya que deja a crédito lo cual le permite vender mucho mas ya que dándoles facilidades de pago sus clientes le compran mas, lleva más de seis años con su negocio, su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viaja cada fin de mes ya que allá consigue más variedad y diseños.

Este crédito es para ir a Guayaquil a comprar ropa, zapatos, carteras y todo de lo que ella vende ya que se viene la época de Navidad y es cuando más vende. Está en el Banco  Comunal desde su inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado, así como también los beneficios adicionales que brinda. 

Su sueño es tener un local donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
In the citadel of La California de Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, well known for several years as the city of the reales tamarindos, every fifteen days the members of the Communal Bank, The New California, meets.

Mrs. Yina lives in this area and has a common law marriage of which she has three children of 21, 19 and 15 years of age. All of her children are in school, the two oldest are in University, the youngest is in high school and are a great expense for the couple. Mrs. Yina’s husband works at a lathe workshop.

Mrs. Yina is in business, at the beginning she only sold clothing but later with the help of some loans she increased her merchandize and now also sells shoes, purses, and costume jewelry. Her earnings have increased a great deal; she sells her items door to door and goes on her free time to visit her customers, takes their orders and during the weekends collects since she leaves items on credit which allows her to sell more since she gives ease of payments to her customers who in turn buy more. She has more than six years with her business; her merchandize is bought in Guayaquil, city that she travels to every end of the month since she gets greater product variety and design.

The loan will be used to go to Guayaquil to buy clothing, shoes, purses and everything that she sells since the Christmas season is approaching and this is when she sells the most. She has been with the Communal Bank since its inception and is grateful for the opportunity granted as well for the additional benefits that she receives.

Mrs. Yina’s dream is to have a place of her own to sell her products.

loans.use: buy clothing, shoes, purses and everything that she sells.

loans.name: Rossana Paola

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal La Nueva California.

En este lugar vive la señora Paola, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, la mayor estudia en escuela y el menor en jardín de infantes. Vive con sus hijos en la casa de sus padres.
 
La señora Paola se dedica al comercio, vende ropa, sabanas, zapatillas de damas  y carteras, ella sale a recorrer por la localidad donde vive y en ciertas partes de la ciudad, aprovecha cuando sus hijos están en la escuela y así puede realizar sus ventas con más comodidad. Tiene cinco  años con este negocio y gracias a esto ella pude darles lo necesario a  sus hijos. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil todos los fines de mes.

Este crédito es para ir a comprar ropa y zapatillas más que todo ya que es lo más vende y mas en este mes que viene por las fiestas de Navidad y Año Nuevo. Lleva más de tres años  en el Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante y mejorar su situación dia a dia. 

Su sueño es tener su propia casa para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the citadel of La California de Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, well known for several years as the city of the reales tamarindos, every fifteen days the members of the Communal Bank, The New California, meets.

It is in this area that Mrs. Paola lives, she is 29 years old, a single mother of two children of 7 and 4 years of age, the oldest is in school and the youngest is in nursery school. She lives with her children in her parent’s home.

Mrs. Paola is business she sells clothing, sheets, women’s shoes, and purses. She goes around her neighborhood and in certain parts of the city while her children are in school to make her sales with greater ease. She has been in business for some five years and thanks to it she has been able to give her children all that they need. Her merchandize is bought in Guayaquil at the end of every month.

This loan will be used to buy clothing and shoes since that is what she sells most, especially during the upcoming month for the Christmas and New Year holiday season. She has been a part of the Communal Bank for about three years and enjoys the help she receives to get ahead and to improve her standard of living day to day.

Mrs. Paola’s dream is to have her own home for her children and herself.

loans.use: buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON DE JESUS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Abigail es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de humintas, venta de juguetes, venta de ropa, venta de verduras, venta de refrescos, venta de frazadas y edredones, venta de electrodomésticos, salón de peluquería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Abigail es parte integrante, ella indica que hace año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frazadas, cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió recientemente ya que ella anteriormente realizaba el comercio de CD’s, posteriormente pasó a este producto donde le da mayor réditos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frazadas) que adquirirá de la frontera Perú – Bolivia, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta.
