He has two taxis and says that he had great difficulty in obtaining the number plates because they will not sell them to just anyone who wants to work as a taxi driver.  
 
He is seeking a loan to maintain his taxis since the vehicles are quite old.  He says that he is doing well because he works with radios in his cabs, which means there is a base which people can call to request a taxi.  He says that the hardest part of his job is the night shift, because he must not fall asleep.  He wants to do well for his children's sake and he is married to Esperanza who is a housewife.  He says that when he needs a car part, he goes to Toluca, as prices are lower there.  

His ambition is to have a fleet of 5 taxis, as it is a good job which he can leave to his children.
  
The other 11 members of the group are called Guadalupe, Gabriela, Teresa de Jesús, María Estela, Ma. Teresa, María Guadalupe, Maribel, Anahí, Ma. Leonor and Ma. Luz.  They will use their loans for their businesses: video games, women's and children's clothing sales, regional sweets, supplies for avocado production,  sales of underwear and plastic cookware, selling quilts and shoes by mail order etc.

loans.use: to maintain the cars used for a taxi service

loans.name: Muyasar

texts.ru: Муясар 40 летняя женщина. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Уже много лет Муясар  занимается откормом скота ,в этом  ей помогают дети.   Она работает в школе, дополнительно занимается откормом скота.   Муж находится в Российской Федерации  и каждый месяц отправляет деньги, но этого не достаточно на содержание семьи. От  откорма скота она получает очень хорошую прибыль поэтому Муясар старается развивать этот бизнес.  На полученный кредит она планирует купить скот и увеличить поголовье скота.   Она сотрудничает с Арванд с 2011 года и очень благодарно этой организации за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Muyasar is 40 years old. She is married and has four children. Muyasar has been raising cattle for many years now, with the help of her children. She also works at a school. Her husband is in Russia and sends money every month, but it is not enough to support the family. She gets a very good profit from animal husbandry, so Muyasar is trying to develop this business. She plans to use the loan to buy additional cattle to increase her livestock. She has been working with Arvand since 2011 and is very grateful to the organization for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rebar's Group

texts.en:
Rebar is an ambitious, young Iraqi man who has been working as a barber for the last four years. He is 24 years old, married, and a father to one child.

Rebar has a barber shop that is visited frequently by the men in his city. In addition to cutting, dressing, grooming, and styling his customers' hair, he also shaves his customers' hair. The barber shop also offers a nice place for social interaction. Rebar would like to improve his shop and invest in creating a more comfortable and higher quality work area. To be able to pay for the renovation of his shop, Rebar took out a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor; thereby, they are unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: To pay for the renovation of his barber shop

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother to six young children. She lives in Ubay, Bohol. She has been running a sari-sari, or variety store, for almost 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Corazon works hard to earn a living so that she can contribute and support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children.

Corazon is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda, toiletries, and cooking ingredients. With this, she will be able to cater to more buyers, thus increasing her sales and profit.

In the future, Corazon hopes to make her business a success and save money for the continuous education of her children.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda, toiletries, and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Consuelo Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Consuelo del Carmen  es una persona  trabajadora y responsable con sus obligaciones, sus créditos los ha pagado en tiempo y forma. su actividad comercial es el alquiler de servicios higiénicos en uno de los mercados de la capital, atiende el negocio junto a su esposo.

 Solicita a ceprodel un  préstamo  para invertir en mejora de su negocio, reparación y pintura del local con el objetivo de mantener una buena higiene y presentación en el negocio; El crédito anterior lo utilizo para comprar más insumos de limpieza (cloro, ambientadores, etc.)

Se siente agradecida con ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por medio de los préstamos a incrementado su negocio y le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda y tener  una  condición mejor de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Consuelo del Carmen is a hardworking person who has a responsible attitude towards her obligations.  She has repaid her loans in a timely and appropriate manner.  Her business, which she runs with her husband, involves hiring out toilet facilities in one of the capital's markets.  

She is seeking a loan from Ceprodel to improve her business by renovating and painting the premises so as to maintain a good standard of hygiene and presentation.  She used the previous loan to buy more cleaning supplies (chlorine, air fresheners, etc.)

She is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva for giving her the opportunity and for putting their confidence in her.  The loans have enabled her to expand her business, improve her home and provide better living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to sustain her business, buy paint and improve her business

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is 31 years old, married, and has three children. To earn a living, he has a motorbike transportation business. He mainly transports foodstuffs such as cakes and bread to retail shops. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills. In the future, Stanley hopes to buy a truck for his transportation business. He has requested a loan of 105,300 KES to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира молодая женщина,мать 4х детей,работает в детском саду воспитателем.   Её муж  работает частными работами и содержит семью за счет строительных работ. Так как семья молодая, Замира хочет улучшить свои домашние условия и купить недостающую  мебель.  На её зарплату  невозможно отложить деньги на такие крупные расходы.  Поэтому они с мужем решили получить кредит и осуществить  свои  бытовые планы.  Она имеет дополнительный доход от присмотра за скотом и надеется, что сэкономит деньги на ежемесячное погашение кредита. Замира благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Zamira is a young woman, the mother of four children. She works as a kindergarten teacher. Her husband provides for the family by taking out private work assignments as a building contractor. Since their family is young, Zamira would like to improve their living condition and buy missing items of furniture. Her salary doesn’t allow saving money for such major purchases. Therefore she and her husband decided to take out a loan and realize their plans for the household. Zamira earns additional income raising livestock and hope to save money in order for the monthly payments. Zamira thanks Arvand for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en: Poni is a business woman in Juba. She has benefited a lot from her previous loans. They have allowed her to increase her business stock, pay part of her children's school fees. Now, she is taking out another loan to purchase more tomatoes, onions, and other food items. She says that she happy for the loans from Finance Sudan Limited.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, onions and other food items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga earns a living by selling home-cooked foods and snacks to the people in her place in Ubay, Bohol. She also has been running a sari-sari or variety store business for several years now.

Dominga is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for her food vending business like sugar, flour, and butter and groceries for her variety store. With this, she will be able to increase her sales and income.

Dominga aims to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food vending business like sugar, flour, butter and groceries for her variety store

loans.name: Gloria Esther

texts.es:
Gloria con 31 años de edad, originaria de Granada, casada, madre de 5  hijos entre las edades de 1, 3, 7, 12, 15 años respectivamente, de oficio comerciante . Ella inicio trabajando desde muy joven con su mama,  pero al casarse se independizo, vendiendo leña en un carretón de caballo, luego adquirió un pequeño financiamiento, con el cual se ayudo y  pudo comprar frutas y verduras para ir a vender al mercado, negocio del cual sobrevive a diario con su familia. 
 Gloria solicita el préstamo para comprar plátanos, cebolla, papa, naranja, limón y melón etc. Ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar más producto que aun no tiene en existencias, sus  planes  futuro es tener otro carretón de caballo para salir a vender mas variedad de frutas en todo el mercado, de esta manera ella lograría  incrementar sus ventas y así obtener mejores ganancias y logran alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria, 31, is a native of Granada.  She is married, and is the mother of 5 children aged 1, 3, 7, 12, and 15.  She works in retail trade. She started working with her mother when she was very young, but when she married she became independent, selling firewood from a horse cart.  Later, she was able to get a small amount of financing which enabled her to buy fruits and vegetables that she could go out and sell in the market.  From this business, she and her family get their daily support.

Gloria is requesting a loan to buy bananas, onions, potatoes, oranges, lemons, melons, etc. Since she thinks that this loan will help her to buy more products, and products that she does not currently have in stock, she plans to get another cart in the future so that she could go out to sell a greater variety of fruits throughout the market.  In this way, she would be able to increase her sales and thereby obtain more earnings, allowing her to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bananas, onions, potatoes, oranges, lemons, melons, etc.

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es:
Fernando de 27 años de edad es originario de Managua, actualmente vive en Granada, casado, de oficio comerciante, trabaja vendiendo ropa desde hace 3 años. El cuenta que su esposa inicio trabajando en una tienda, con el tiempo ellos  vieron que ese negocio era  muy rentable y fue allí donde decidieron establecer su propio negocio con un capital que tenían ahorrado.
Cuenta con otros ingresos ya que en ocasiones trabaja en un supermercado  y aporta para los  gastos de la casa. Tiene  como expectativa hacer crecer  su mercadería de ropa  de alta demanda en la clientela. Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa variada como pantalones, blusas, faldas y carteras para damas.  Ya que sus planes futuros es llegar a tener un local en donde puedan establecer una tienda. Sus metas futuras es crecer en el inventario de su negocio.
texts.en:
Fernando, 27, is originally from Managua but now lives in Granada; he’s married and is a merchant by profession.  He has been working selling clothes for three years.  He relates that his wife started working in a store and in time they realized that this was a very profitable business and that’s when they decided to open their own business with some savings they had.

He also has another source of income in that he occasionally works in a supermarket and contributes towards household expenses.  His expectation is to increase his clothing merchandise to meet high customer demand.  He’s requesting the loan to buy assorted clothes like pants, blouses, skirts and women’s purses because his future plan is to have a place in which they can establish their store.  His future goal is to increase his store’s inventory.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothes.

loans.name: Maibem Leirak Group

texts.en:
This group of 10 women are best known as Maibem Leirak group. In 2010, they come together to stand united for one another and form this group. They belong to a non-tribal community living here in Manipur state on the outskirts of Imphal East district located in the North Eastern part of India. 

The woman pictured with raised hand is called Ngoubi and is the profile representative of the group. She is 20 years old and is mother to a two-year-old son. She still shares the same kitchen with her in-laws but did not get any financial support. Her husband, 22 years old, is a seasonal farmer. In the off season, usually, sand sieving is his way of earning income for the family.

 In order to supplement their income, Ngoubi started her line of weaving activities. She uses a handloom to weave. (A sample handloom can be seen in the picture behind the members.)
 
With her first loan, Ngoubi was able to increase her production as compared to before the loan. The cloth that she weaves includes bed covers, wrap-  around skirts, and cloth usable for towels and shawls. She supplies her products at the market at reasonable rates. She is happy that she is in good health to support the family income. With the profit that she earns, she usually puts aside some amount to deposit in the group savings on a weekly basis. In this way every time she gets a loan, she has been able to increase her production. She is happy that from her business earnings, she helped her husband purchase a new shovel and a filter bar for his sand-sieving activities. She has been saving most of her profits as well as her husband's income for a separate home very soon. She has been doing this weaving activity for the past 4 years now.

Now she needs another loan to continue and do better with her business. She will buy materials required such as yarn of various colours and textures to weave wrap-around skirts, shawls, bed covers, etc. She also means to buy the finished products from other weavers to supply at the market for a profit.

Likewise, the rest of the group members too are making steady improvement like her with their respective income-generating activities. Most of the group members are engaged in retailing rice; some have a business of 'paan' shop, vegetable-selling and fuel retailer.

They literally thank all the lenders and wish life's best gifts to all the lenders and success in everything they do.

loans.use: To buy stocks of yarns in different colours and textures for weaving and to buy finished products from other weavers to sell.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés, de 43 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de Natalia su esposa desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos menores: Abel y Angelis, a los que cuidan en una casa alquilada. Desde muy joven se dedicó a la construcción, su oficio de albañil le sirvió para obtener el dinero necesario y solventar los gastos diarios del hogar. Pero hace poco sufrió un accidente aunque ya se encuentra rehabilitado, dejó de ejercer ese oficio hasta que se encuentre recuperado por completo. A raíz de ello comenzó a vender dulces en la escuela de su localidad, donde obtiene lo necesario para sobrevivir, ya por las noches cuida el almacén del colegio donde vive, ahí obtiene un sueldo mensual. Sabe que muy pronto se mejorará, y podrá retomar el oficio que le gusta y que le dejaba buenos ingresos para su hogar. Asimismo su esposa dedica su tiempo al negocio de fotocopias, pues hace poco compraron una. Ellos trabajan juntos como un equipo ganador. Por eso espera de su apoyo para sobresalir. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “las mujeres del éxito” y este es el segundo préstamo con MFP, agradece el apoyo que le brindan, ya que adquiere el capital de trabajo que necesita para poder progresar en su negocio. Promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Moisés, invertirá el dinero en la compra de papeles por millar y tintes para su fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Moisés is 43 years old and is a responsible mam. He has lived in the company of his wife of Natalia for 20 years. They have two young children together, Abel and Angelis. They raise their children in a rental home. He worked in construction since he was very young and his mason skills helped him get the money that he needed and to cover his daily household expenses. However, he suffered from an accident recently and although he has rehabilitated, he left this trade until he has fully recovered. 

As a result of the accident, he began to sell candy in the neighborhood school where he receives enough money to survive. He also watches over the local school's storage area at night, where he receives a monthly salary. He knows that he will get better very soon and be able to take up his work again which he enjoys and had allowed him to receive a good income for his home. At the same time, his wife makes a living in a photocopy store and 
recently they bought the store. They work together as a winning team. For this reason he awaits support to excel. 

He belongs to the solidarity group "Las Mujeres del Éxito" and this is his second loan with MFP. He is thanksful for the support that is brought to him because he has already acquired the working capital needed to continue the business. He promises to be punctual with his loan installments. Moisés will invest the money to buy paper in sets of a thousan and ink for the copy machine.

loans.use: to buy paper in packages of a thousand and ink for his copy machine.

loans.name: Moradita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MORADITA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Bertha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompa, venta de comida, venta de ají, venta de fruta, carnicería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Bertha es parte integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne, cuenta que este negocio es de su madre y en la actualidad ambas lo trabajan con capitales diferentes.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne) que adquirirá de los mataderos de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud
texts.en:
The Communal Bank ”Moradita" will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Regional Office. It is made up of six members and led by a Board of Directors in which Bertha is the President. The businesses in which the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among the businesses are the following: the weaving of sweaters, sale of food, sale of peppers, sale of fruits and a butcher shop. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesses in various sectors. Bertha indicates that this is her first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she had entered by invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she runs a business selling meat which is owned by her mother. However, they both work within the business with separate capital. 

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital by buying meat that she will acquire from the slaughterhouses in the city of El Alto. She will then sell the meat in her business space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her home as much as possible. She is married and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the credit and health education.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es: Don Isidro a sus 60 años continua trabajando en su taxi y su esposa en la venta de fritanga comida típica del país con estos ingresos ellos apoyan a su hijo de 17 años quien cursa el quinto año de la secundaria, se sienten satisfechos porque le han brindado estudios a sus otros hijos que ya son casados e independientes, don Isidoro poco a poco ha venido haciéndole mejoras a su hogar y también ha reparado su vehículo cuando está en malas condiciones, con ayuda de préstamos de Afodenic y Kiva a quienes agradece mucho por facilitar sus condiciones de vida, ahora con este noveno crédito desea comprar materiales de construcción para seguir mejorando su casa, esta vez comprara arena, piedrín, hierro, cemento y cerámica para reparar el piso e instalar cerámica en su vivienda.
texts.en: Isidoro, 60, continues working with his taxi and his wife selling national traditional fried fast-food snacks.  With the income they earn they support their 17-year-old son who is in fifth year of secondary school.  They feel satisfied because they’ve provided education for their other children who are all now married and independent.  Isidoro has gradually been doing home improvements and has also been repairing his vehicle when it’s been in poor condition with help from Afodenic and Kiva loans who he’s very grateful to for improving his living conditions.  Now, with this ninth loan he wants to buy building materials and supplies to continue improving his house.  This time he will buy sand, gravel, iron, cement and tile to repair the floor and to lay tile at home.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair the floor and lay tile.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.en:
Shuhratjon is a very hard-working and industrious man. He is 26 years old. He is married and has three children. Work in education requires much sacrifice and follow-through in teaching/learning. Shuhratjon works as a teacher at a school teaching youngsters of various ages where he imparts knowledge with dignity. His main concern is educating these people since they are future of the nation and improving standards of living. 

He likes his profession very much and works with pleasure but his salary is small and he can’t buy all the necessary things for his family. His wife is a housewife and has no source of income. Also, Shuhratjon’s parents live with him. They are pensioners. 

So Shuhratjon is the only breadwinner in the family. If he were to buy consumer goods,  his salary would not be enough for buying vegetables and other food products for his family. So, for some years they have not had a TV set and can’t buy one. His children ask him to buy a TV set every day and that is why he decided to ask for a loan of 2000 somoni to buy a TV set for his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a TV set for his family

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco Javier  de 46 años de edad casado con cuatro hijos a su cargo todo en edad escolar, todos originario de la ciudad de Estelí ciudad ubicada en el norte de Nicaragua. 
Actualmente se desempeña como agente de seguridad, su salario lo destina para los gasto del hogar.

A pesar de compromiso familiar y su edad Francisco está estudiando, cursando el primer años de administración de empresa lo estudio lo realiza diario en horario de la noche, se caracteriza por ser una persona con mucha visión y con buen ánimo de salir adelante y lograr su meta de culminar sus estudio superiores y poder graduarse.

El crédito que solicita a ceprodel es para gastos de estudios universitarios ya que necesita pagar la matrícula y pago de mensualidad del próximo año lectivo.

Francisco agradece a ceprodel y a kiva  ya que a si sera posible continuar con sus estudios superiores y poder realizar su sueños de ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier, 46, is married and has four children in his care who are all school age; they are all from the city of Estelí located in northern Nicaragua.  He currently works as a security agent and his salary is used for household expenses.  Despite his family obligation, Francisco is studying; he’s in the first year of Business Administration.  He attends night classes every day and he’s noted for being a man who is very forward-thinking and well disposed towards getting ahead and reaching his goal of completing his higher education and graduating.

The loan he’s asking Ceprodel for is to pay for his university courses because he needs to pay enrollment and monthly tuition fees for the coming academic term.  Francisco thanks Ceprodel and Kiva because it will be possible to continue with his higher studies and reach his dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to pay enrollment fee and monthly tuition.

loans.name: Martha  Clelin

texts.es:
Estelí el diamante de las Segovia de esta bella ciudad es originaria Martha Clelin  de estado civil soltera, tiene a su cargo un hijo en edad escolar.

Martha es profesora de preescolar de un colegio público y tiene más de diez años de trabajar con niños y niñas, es una maestra muy motivadora entregada a su trabajo y expresa que siente bien trabajar con niños porque es una experiencia bonita.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materiales de construcción, (zinc y azulejos) ya que necesita realizar mejora en el techo de su vivienda ya que se ha deteriorado.

Martha se siente alegre y motivada por el apoyo brindado por ceprodel y kiva y que a si le dará mejor condición a su vivienda y comodidad a su familia.
texts.en: Martha Clelin is from the beautiful city of Estelí, The Diamond of the Segovias.  She’s single and has a son in her care.  Martha is a preschool teacher in a public school and has been working with boys and girls for more than ten years.  She’s a very motivated teacher who is devoted to her work and says that she feels good working with children because it’s a beautiful experience.  The loan she’s requesting is to buy building materials (metal sheeting and tile) because she needs to repair her house’s roof that’s deteriorated.  Martha feels happy and motivated by the help Ceprodel and Kiva have given her because she’ll giver better conditions to her dwelling and comfort to her family.

loans.use: to buy building maerials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale

loans.name: Top Mayai Leikai Group

texts.en:
This is “Top Mayai Leikai” group of 5 members formed in 2010. All of them are happily married and have children of their own. They belong to a non-tribal community living on the outskirts of Imphal East district of Manipur state in the North Eastern part of India. 

Sandha is the profile member pictured with raised hand. She is 31 years old and is a mother to two sons of 12 years and seven years old. Her husband, 37 years old, is a seasonal farmer by trade. In order to supplement the family income, in her previous business she used to sell jewellery by visiting house to house. Bangles, necklaces, earrings, etc. were some of the items she sold. Being a housewife, it was never easy for her to continue with this jewellery business.

With her first loan in 2010 and with her saved money, she started a clothes business. She sells ready-made garments--kids' wear, vests, socks, and face towels (locally woven). She did well with this business and at the same time she was able to lend a helping hand as is required of her as a mother. The second loan helped her to increase her store's stock of clothes to sell and also helped her to renovate her store by extending their porch into a store. She is happy that she is making progress in terms of her business which enhances her security for the future. Unlike what happened to herself and her husband, she wants to provide her children a good opportunity for their education.

Sandha now needs another loan for her business. She will use the loan to buy more kids' wear to sell. She will also buy kids' shoes to resell apart from the usual items that she has been selling. She has plans to expand her business and specialize in kids' products down the road.

Likewise, the rest of the group members too are making improvements like Sandha and needed loans for their respective income-generating activities. Sand sieving activities, piggery farming, and pottery are the primary activities of the group members.

loans.use: To buy more kids' wear such as shoes, shirts, pants, and vests to expand the range of products that she sells in her store.

loans.name: Lamngambi Group

texts.en:
This is Lamngambi group of 5 members. In 2010, these hard-working women joined hands to support themselves through loan facilities. They belong to a Metei tribal village in Manipur State which is in the North Eastern part of India. It is about half an hour's drive from the main city Imphal.

Ibecha is the member pictured with raised hand. She is 40 years old and is mother to a son and two daughters. Her husband is an army pensioner and now spends his time in poultry farming and raising ducks. In order to supplement the family income she started a business using her weaving expertise. She uses the handloom method of weaving.

With her first loan she employed two weavers for weaving. She produces traditional wrap-arounds with a design called “Rani Phi,” well known on the national market. It usually takes about 10 days to complete one wrap-around. Through the loan she actually produced 50 wrap-arounds to sell and earned a good profit. She helps her husband to buy poultry feeding requirements and supports her son in a tutorial class after the school hour. She is very happy with the progress she has made in her business. 

Now Ibecha needs another loan to continue her weaving activities. She will use the loan to buy more yarns of different qualities and colours to weave and increase the production of traditional tribal wrap-around skirts for her business. 

Likewise, the rest of the group members too needed the loan to upgrade their respective business undertakings. Sand sieving, jewellery business, weaving, and vegetable selling are the primary activities of the group members. As a group, the members meet every weekend for saving a fixed amount of INR 50 per member. In this way they function as a group.

loans.use: To buy yarns of different textures and colours to weave traditional skirts to sell.

loans.name: Noral

texts.en: Noral is a 37-year-old lady who lives in Ground Bassa County, one of the counties noted for fishing. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 20 years old. Her children are in school and live at home. For years now, she been she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She was helped by her husband to start her business, which is how she makes her living. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil to resell. She hopes to build a new home for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to resell,

loans.name: Alexandra Mercedes

texts.es:
Alexandra de 32 años de edad soltera, originario del perla septentrión Matagalpa una bella ciudad e importante por su gran producción de café ubicada en la parte norte de Nicaragua.

La joven Alexandra es trabajadora de una empresa estatal desde hace año y medio desempeñándose como responsable de área de acueducto, sus ingresos de sus salario lo destina para gastos del hogar ya que tiene dos hijos a su cargo ambos en edad escolar.

El crédito que solicita a ceprodel lo va destinar para la compra de una computadora portátil ya que le va ser útil para su trabajo y el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en: Alexandra, 32, is single and from Matagalpa, The Pearl of the North, a beautiful city in northern Nicaragua important because of its abundant coffee production.  Young Alexandra has worked for a government firm for a year and a half heading the aqueduct department.  She uses her salary to cover household expenses since she has two children in her care who are both school age.  The loan she’s requesting from Ceprodel is to buy a laptop computer that will be useful both for her work and for her children’s school work.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Wiñay Marka Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WIÑAY MARKA”  iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eva María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: confección de mantas de vicuña, costura de pantalones, tejido de mantas, venta de celulares, tienda de carnicería, tienda de abarrotes, servicio de transporte público.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Eva María es parte integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene dos negocios de venta de fruta y tienda de barrio, cuenta que estos negocio los apertura por iniciativa de sus padres desde sus 14 años ya que ellos querían otorgarles un espacio de trabajo independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de panetones y fideo) que adquirirá de los distribuidores de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Wiñay Marka” communal bank will start its seventh cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Eva María.  The communal bank members have various businesses among which are vicuña blanket weaving, pants making, blanket weaving, mobile phone sales, butcher shop, grocery store and public transportation service.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small, micro businesswomen in different lines of work.  Eva María is one of the members. She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for a year having been invited to join by an institution promoter who visited her at home.  She currently has two businesses: fruit sales and a grocery store.  She relates that the businesses were started by her parents when she was 14-years-old because they wanted to give them a space where they could work independently.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy panettones and noodles from suppliers in the city of El Alto and then sell them in her store.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate resources to support her home however possible since she’s single and has a son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy panettones and noodles.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad, de 32 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Percy su esposo desde hace 10 años, ambos tienen 2 hijos a los que cuida en una casa alquilada. Todas las madrugadas, comienza a separar los pollos por tamaños, clases y calidad, divididos por una cantidad de 10, cuando tiene el pedido completo junto a su esposo trasladan la carne de los mismos a los diferentes restaurantes tiendas, supermercados y demás lugares donde venderán el alimento. Este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que es una de los pocos distribuidores.  Además que se encarga de repartirlos, hasta su propio centro de trabajo, eso hace que ella, obtenga muchos clientes fijos. Asimismo por las noches vende hamburguesas y frituras en la puerta de su casa, donde obtiene ganancias extras. Ahora desea incrementar sus ganancias, pues piensa criar ella misma los pollos que después matará para vender la carne y de esa manera no tendrá que comprar a otras granjas. Además de criar también cuyes, para comercializarlos, ya que su carne se consume mucho. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “las mujeres del éxito” y este es el segundo préstamo con MFP, agradece el apoyo que le brindan, ya que adquiere el capital de trabajo que necesita para poder progresar en su negocio. Promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Soledad, invertirá el dinero en completar el capital de trabajo que posee, para la compra de pollos por cantidad para su venta, ya que en este mes es donde ella vende más.
texts.en:
Soledad is 32 years old and a hard working woman. She lives in the company of her husband of 10 years, Percy. They have two children together that they raise in a rental house. Every day at dawn she begins to organize her chickens by size, class and quality, divided in quantities of ten. When she has completed an order she transports the meat with her husband to various restaurants, shops, supermarkets and other businesses that will sell the food. 

This business is very profitable for her because she is one of few distibutors. In addition she y sh separates the meat into pieces at her own business space, allowing her to obtain many regular customers. She also sells hamburgers and fried food from her home where she gets additional earnings. She now would like to increase her earnings by raising and slaughtering the chickens herself to sell. This way, she will not have to buy from other farms. She also plans to grow guinea pigs to sell because this type of meat is popular. 

She belongs to the solidarity group "Las Mujeres del Éxito" and this is her second loan with MFP. She is thankful for the support that is brought to her because she is receiving the working capital she needs to advance her business. She is committed to paying her installments on time. 

Soledad will invest the money to compliment the working capital that she has. She will buy chickens to sell because she sells the most during this month.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Mirtalia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Mirtalia de los Ángeles, trabajadora, y emprendedora, labora diario desde las siete de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, los siete días de la semana en su negocio venta de ropa, en uno de los mercados capitalinos. 

 Solicita el  préstamo a Ceprodel para invertir en capital de trabajo, para la  compra de trajes de señoras y trajes para niñas. Esto con el propósito de comprar mas productos, ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes y captar mas compradores.

  Agradece  a  ceprodel y Kiva por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por lo que este crédito lo invertirá en su negocio   de forma que esto le permitirá llevar el sustento a su hogar  e ir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mirtalia de los Ángeles is a hardworking, enterprising woman who works daily from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm, seven days a week, in her clothing sales business, located in one of the capital city markets.

She is asking for a loan through Ceprodel, in order to invest in working capital so that she can buy ladies’ and girls’ outfits.  She wants to buy more products so that she can offer a greater variety to her customers and gain new customers.

She is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva for the opportunity and trust given her.  She will invest the money from this loan into her business.  It will allow her to support her household and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy girls' and ladies' outfits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale

loans.name: October

texts.en: Mrs. October, 27 years old, lives with her husband and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She works as an accountant for a local bank and her husband renders a taxi service. Her mother works at a company that sells cosmetics. She has been working for four consecutive years in the banking sector, moving from teller to accountant. As winter comes to Mongolia, their home and automobile are freezing, so they decided to build a garage next to their house. The garage will keep the car unfrozen and stop the house from losing its heat. The constantly frozen car has several disadvantages such as emitting harmful chemicals into atmosphere and using more natural gas to operate. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy construction materials and hire builders. If the garage is built, it will benefit many things such as the family's wellbeing, house heating, automobile operation and most importantly the environment.

loans.use: to build a garage

loans.name: Felipe Armando

texts.es:
Felipe originario de la Comarca el Riego, Teustepe, con 51 años de edad, casado, padre de 4 hijos entre las edades de 16, 18, 23 y 25 años respectivamente, de oficio agricultor. El inicio su actividad desde muy joven ayudándoles a sus padres. Felipe  además de cultivar granos básicos también se dedica a la venta de ropa y colchones por temporada, mercadería de las cuales ha venido comprando, de las ganancias que saca de la cosecha,  paga mano de obra, sus productos los comercializa en Managua. Cuando no está sembrando invierte en comprar mercadería de uso doméstico para conseguir otros ingresos
Felipe en esta ocasión esta  solicitando el crédito para comprar zapatos y colchones con el objetivo de obtener otros ingresos, sus planes futuros es cancelar el crédito con los ingresos que le genere  este negocio  y seguir  comprando mas tierras, su meta próxima es comprar  ganado para la producción de leche.
texts.en:
Felipe is from the El Riego district, Teustepe.  He’s 51-years-old, married and the father of four children aged 16, 18, 23 and 25 years, respectively.  He’s a farmer.  He started his work very young helping his parents.  In addition to growing basic grains, Felipe also works selling clothes and mattresses seasonally, merchandise he’s been buying gradually.  With profits from the harvest sales he pays labor costs.  He sells his products in Managua.  When he’s not planting he invests in home use products to earn other income.

On this occasion, Felipe is asking for a loan to buy shoes and mattresses aiming at earning additional income.  His future plan is to repay the loan with income this business generates and continue to buy more land.  His next goal is to buy cattle for milk production.

loans.use: to buy shoes and mattresses.

loans.name: Brenda Esperanza

texts.es:
La joven Brenda  de 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo y  tiene 02 hijos que dependen de ella y su casa es propia, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al su de Honduras.
La Joven Brenda se dedica desde hace 04  años a su negocio  que es la de venta de pan, lácteos, paletas y jugos naturales, realiza sus ventas de forma ambulante y sus clientes son los alumnos de las escuelas aledañas a su comunidad, vecinos y amigos que ella visita a diario.
La Joven Brenda está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de huevos, harina, Levadura, soda, azúcar, leche, sandia, piña, nance y fresas que son la materia prima para elaborar los panes y los jugos, con el apoyo de este préstamo espera suplir sus  necesidades y mejorar un poco su condición de vida, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma. 
La Joven Brenda su sueño es de  seguir mejorando su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2012.
texts.en:
Brenda is a young woman of 24. She lives with her husband and has two children who depend on her. She lives in her own home in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. 

Brenda has been in her business for four years, which is the sale of bread, dairy products, popsicles and natural juices. She carries on her sales as a street vendor. Her customers are the students of schools adjacent to her community, neighbors and friends who visit her every day. 

Brenda is applying for the loan so that she can buy eggs, flour, yeast, baking soda, sugar, milk, watermelon, pineapple, nance fruit and strawberries, which are the ingredients for making her breads and juices. 

With the help of this loan, she hopes to meet her needs and improve her standard of living a little. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma. Brenda's dream is to keep improving her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2012.

loans.use: To buy eggs, flour, yeast, baking soda, sugar, milk, watermelon, pineapple, nance fruit and strawberries for her business.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia Patricia
Cría de Credos
500.000
 	Mujer joven y emprendedora ha tenido la actitud para hacer frente a la actividad y criar a su hijo de 1 año. Con  el apoyo de su esposo y suegro,  ha logrado grandes avances en la cría de cerdos de engorde, a pesar de los bajos precios de medio año; solicita este préstamo para comprar alimento para los cerdos que están en la etapa de desarrollo. La granja de cerdos  ha  crecido y requiere del apoyo económico para mejorar las condiciones de 2 de los activos más importantes de la granja, las cerdas de cría,  un varraco,  y los cerdos que se están engordando y tiene cerca de 3 meses.
 
Lidia  tiene 3 años en la cría de estos animales,  cuenta con los chiqueros, cerdos y en esta ocasión se requiere completar el dinero para el alimento de 17 cerdos que se están criando.Se espera sacar esta  camada en el mes de Mayo, cancelando la primera cuota y obteniendo el dinero para invertir en más alimentación ya que cuenta con la parte de cría e inseminación. Se espera traigan 24 cerdos para el engorde e iniciar este nuevo ciclo.

 Este préstamo incrementará este apartado ya que se requiere para cubrir los 2 periodos siguientes Desarrollo y Engorde, con el cual se tendrá la proyección esperada de cerdos engordados para el mes de Mayo del 2013. Se proyecta cancelar en 2 pagos semestrales uno en junio y otro en diciembre. De acuerdo a las necesidades de la granja, esta proyección permite tener capital en el medio año para iniciar otro ciclo de cría de cerdos y  cubrir los pagos respectivos. Como complemento a la  alimentación se siembra de maíz y plátano de la finca para aumentar el peso al final del período.



Es un negocio familiar, se ha dado un crecimiento importante ya que se cuenta con dos cerdas para la cría de los cerdos desde su nacimiento hasta su venta, teniendo todo el ciclo de producción dentro de la granja. Ya se efectuó la inversión  para mejorar las condiciones de estos animales para las labores de parto y desarrollo de los lechones, comprando parideras y acondicionando un sector de la porqueriza, aumentando a 3 las zonas de cría de cerdos para engorde, dando así un importante empuje al crecimiento desarrollado en el último año por esta actividad. Se realizó también la compra de verraco de raza de engorde para la reproducción de las cerdas, dando la seguridad de tener un animal que va a tener un buen desarrollo brindándole la alimentación adecuada, que es la parte en la que el negocio ha tenido problemas de liquidez para la compra del producto.
texts.en:
Lidia Patricia
Pig Raising
500.000

A young, enterprising woman who has had the attitude to face her activity and raise her one-year-old son.   With support from her husband and her father-in-law, she’s attained great progress raising pigs despite low, mid-year prices.  She’s requesting this loan to buy feed for the pigs that are still in the growing stage.  The pig farm has grown and needs economic support to improve the conditions of the two most important assets in her farm: the breeding sows and a stud male and the pigs that she’s fattening up and are about 3-months-old.

Lidia has been raising pigs for three years.  She has the pigpens, pigs and needs money to have enough to buy feed for 17 pigs she’s raising.  She hopes to finish with this litter in May and repay her first loan installment and then get the money to invest in more feed because then the insemination and care starts.  She hopes the new cycle will produce 24 pigs to raise.

This loan will increase what’s set aside because it’s needed to cover the next two Development and Fattening-Up periods with which the expected number of fattened-up pigs for May, 2013, would be obtained.  The loan is projected to be repaid in two, semi-yearly payments, one in June and one in December.  According to the farm’s needs, this projection will allow for capital at mid-year to start a new cycle of raising pigs and making the respective payments.  Feeding will be complemented also with growing corn and bananas on the farm to increase their weight at the end of the period.

This is a family business and it’s grown considerably because it has two breeding sows to care for piglets from birth to sale; the entire production cycle is contained within the farm.  An investment in these animals has already been made to improve the birth and development of the piglets.  Birthing units were purchased and a sector of the pigsties was equipped increasing to three the zones for raising pigs.  This gave an important growth impulse to the business last year.  A pedigree stud pig was also purchased to breed with the sows thus guaranteeing production of good animals that if fed properly will develop well and this is the part of the business that lack of liquidity creates problems for.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica, de 24 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Ravelo, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jeyson y Zahorí, a los que cuida en casa de sus suegros. Desde las primeras horas del día, trabaja junto a su esposo en la fábrica de zapatos. Donde todos los días confecciona diversos tamaños y estilos de calzados, los que vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Ahí obtiene muchas ganancias, con lo que pueden sustentar los gastos económicos y de estudio de sus hijos. Por su parte ella vende productos de belleza por catálogos, a los pobladores de su localidad, los que siempre le consumen, ya tiene clientes fijos, como le gusta la venta horizontales, también realiza reparación de calzados como también diseña las ultimas tendencias, este servicio lo realiza a domicilio, ya que desea obtener muchas ventas y así poder comenzar con su propio negocio. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “las mujeres del éxito” y este es el segundo préstamo con MFP, agradece el apoyo que le brindan, ya que adquiere el capital de trabajo que necesita para poder progresar en su negocio. Promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Jessica, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de cueros y demás insumos para la elaboración de zapatillas.
texts.en:
Jessica is 24 years old and is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband Ravelo. They have 2 children, Jeyson and Zahori, whom they are raising at her in-laws house. She starts working very early every day, by her husband's side, at the shoe factory, where she makes shoes of different sizes and styles which she sells at the city's wholesale market. There she gets good earnings which enable her to pay for her children's education as well as for household expenses. 
She also sells beauty products from catalogs to residents of her neighborhood who always use them. She has many loyal clients as she likes to sell door-to-door. She also repairs shoes and designs fashionable and trendy shoes from home. She is hoping to make many sales so she can start her own business. She belongs to the group "las mujeres del exito" (successful women) and this is her second loan from MFP. She is grateful for the help she is offered as it allows her to get the working capital she needs to expand her business. She promises to meet her payments on time. Jessica will use the money she requests to purchase leather and other supplies to make shoes.

loans.use: to purchase leather and other supplies to make shoes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es: Susan, de 21 años; es una joven luchadora. Vive en compañía de su mamá Yolanda, su papá Walter y su hermano José, en la casa de sus padres, desde que nació. Estudia ingeniería civil en una universidad reconocida, donde paga una mensualidad. Por esa razón incursionó en el negocio de venta de productos para el hogar. Con el tiempo juntó lo necesario para abrir una ferretería simple, aún le falta mucho, pero espera que con su esfuerzo de resultados y pueda hacer que su negocio sea reconocido y sobre todo rentable. Ahora su principal ingreso se centra en la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, además de comida, en sociedad con su mamá que le ofreció un espacio de su casa, donde abre todos los domingos, en la feria que se desarrolla en la calle que da a su casa, por lo que está obteniendo muchas ganancias, ya que es concurrida. Desea mejorar las ganancias que percibe, pues desea culminar sus estudios y comenzar nuevos proyecto, sabe que para lograrlo necesita un buen capital de dinero, que está segura de ahorrar. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este el crédito número 10 con  MFP, en todo estos años, pudo mejorar su negocio, pues aprovechó el dinero con mucha inteligencia. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, donde los integrantes son solidarios, “como una familia”, afirma. Susan; invertirá el dinero en la compra de varias cajas de bebidas de toda calidad y tipo, pues en estas fiestas navideñas en donde consumen más.
texts.en:
21-yer-old Susana is a determined woman. She lives in her parents’ house with Yolanda, her mother, Walter, her father, and José, her brother. She studies civil engineering in a prestigious university, where she has to pay her own tuition. This is why she started with the business of selling household products. 

After some time she saved enough to open a hardware store, which is only starting, but which with her effort she hopes to make grow. Currently her main source of income comes from selling of drinks and food. She teamed up with her mother to open up a space in her house every Sunday to serve her customers. Additionally there is a fair that takes place in the street in which she lives. This contributes to her revenues, as her business is always very busy. 

She wishes to increase her profits, as she wants to finish her studies and start new projects. She knows that in order to achieve this she needs to save a certain amount of money. She is part of the communal bank “IDME”, and from which she has been able to get 10 loans throughout the years to improve her business by managing the money in a wise way.  She promises to keep paying her dues. Susana is glad to be able part of this organization, where the members are solidary, “like a family”, she affirms. Susana will invest her loan in the purchase of several boxes of drinks of every type because it is during Christmas time that consumption of her products is the highest.

loans.use: to purchase of boxes of drinks of every type.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a photocopier for her bookstore.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, de 54 años es una mujer líder. Ella vive en compañía de Walter, su esposo desde hace 28 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Mabel y José a los que cuidan en su casa propia. Es tesorera de su asociación, pues siempre gusto de administrar el dinero. Gracias a ello ahora tiene una ferretería, equipada y surtida. Según cuenta le va muy bien en su negocio; pues abre sus puertas todos los días sin descanso. Pero como ella es una mujer trabajadora, no solo se dedica a ello. También vende comida los domingos, en un espacio de su casa. Por su parte, su esposo se dedica al alquiler de maquinarias pesadas a instituciones del estado y constructoras privadas, las que le brindan un pago mensual, con ello paga los estudios universitarios de sus hijos; a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación. Ahora quiere surtir su tienda, con todo el material posible, “existen días en las que llegan compradores grandes que se llevan cemento y demás materiales por cantidad y no me abastezco”, afirma. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este el crédito número 28 con  MFP, en todo estos años, pudo mejorar su negocio, pues aprovechó el dinero con mucha inteligencia. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, donde los integrantes son solidarios, “como una familia”, afirma.
Yolanda, invertirá el dinero en la compra de arena, cemento y demás mercadería para surtir su ferretería.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 54, is a woman who is a leader.  She lives with Walter, her husband of 28 years.  They have two children together: Mabel and José who they care for in her own house.  She’s her association’s treasurer because she’s always liked to manage money.  Thanks to that, she now has a well-equipped and well-stocked hardware store.  According to what she says, she does very well in her business because she’s open every day with no days off.  But since she’s a very hardworking woman, this isn’t all she does.  She also sells food on Sundays at a space at home.  On his part, her husband works leasing heavy machinery to state institutions and private construction firms that pay him a monthly payment; he’s able to pay his children’s university education with it and he wants to provide them with a better education.  Now, she wants to stock her store better with all possible materials.  “There are days when big buyers come and take cement and other materials in quantity and I don’t have enough,” she affirms.  

She’s a member of the “IDME” communal bank and this is MFP loan # 28.  In all these years, she’s been able to improve her business because she used her money very intelligently.  On the other hand, she once again promises to make her installment payments.  It pleases her to be part of her association where all the members are mutually supportive and “like a family,” she affirms.  Yolanda will use the money to buy sand, cement and other merchandise to stock her hardware store.

loans.use: to buy hardware and building supplies to stock her hardware store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married with two children. She is 61 years old and lives in Bintana, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

Lolita sells bananas to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amount of PHP 12,000 for additional business capital.

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits from the business.

loans.use: to finance her business of buying and selling bananas

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 46 años, es una mujer admirable. Cuidó sola a los 3 hijos que tubo, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos: Jesús y Carmen, a los que cuida en la casa que adquirió, gracias a su trabajo, hace 14 años. Cuando muy joven comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, pues tenía que sacar adelante a sus hijos. Fue entonces que comenzó a forjar su camino, su principal cualidad es la cocina; por ello pensó en aprovechar su talento y abrir un restaurante. Poco a poco, compró lo necesario para encaminar su negocio. Al principio fue difícil, pero ahora cuenta con una cocina industrial y un local equipado, todo ello gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación. Tiene gran clientela, pues la zona donde se encuentra es comercial y hay afluencia de personas, sobre todo los fines de semana; en la feria que se realiza. Ahora ella espera mejorar los platos que sirve, para tener mayor clientela y mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este el crédito número 26 con  MFP, en todo estos años, pudo mejorar su negocio, pues aprovechó el dinero con mucha inteligencia. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, donde los integrantes son solidarios, “como una familia”, afirma. Marina, invertirá el dinero en la compra de un saco de arroz y un saco de azúcar, para poder preparar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Marina is a 46-year-old admirable woman. She raised 3 children on her own, and currently lives with two of then, Jesús and Carmen, in the house in which she was able to buy 14 years ago as a product of her work. She started working since she was very young, to provide for her children. It was then when she started to build her own path. Her main talent is cooking, thus she decided to take advantage of this and opened up a restaurant.

She slowly started getting together what she needed to start her business. At the beginning it was very hard, but now she has an industrial kitchen in a fully equipped premise. This was a product of her effort and dedication. She has a lot of customers, since the zone in which her restaurant is located is a commercial area with a lot of activity. This is true specially on the weekends, as there is a fair which takes place. She wants to improve the dishes that she offers in order to get more clients and profits. 

She is part of the communal bank “IDME”, and from which she has been able to get 26 loans throughout the years to improve her business by managing the money in a wise way.  She promises to keep paying her dues. Marina is glad to be able part of this organization, where the members are solidary, “like a family”, she affirms.

Marina will invest the money in the purchase of a sack of rice and a sack of sugar, to be used to prepare her food.

loans.use: to purchase of a sack of rice and a sack of sugar.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es: Estrella, de 53 años, es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: Wilfredo y Yamileth, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 10 años. Su actividad económica por 20 años, es la venta de carne. Cuenta que su trabajo consiste en la compra de ganado porcino en cantidad, sobre todo los de mayor peso y en estado saludable. Después de adquirirlos, los mata para vender la carne en ferias regionales y de los distritos. Con ellos obtiene buenas ganancias, además aprovecha el puesto que tiene para vender productos de belleza a los clientes que ya la conocen. Le va muy bien en su negocio, “vendo más cantidad de carne en las festividades”, afirma. Hace poco, pintó el ambiente donde abrirá su Chicharronería (lugar donde se vende platos a base de carne de cerdo), donde podrá obtener más ganancias, pues obtendrá la carne de cerdo y ella misma podrá utilizarlo para la elaboración de sus platos. Ya comenzó a trabajar y le va muy bien, ya que se ubica en una zona comercial. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este el crédito número 27 con  MFP, en todo estos años, pudo mejorar su negocio, pues aprovechó el dinero con mucha inteligencia. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, donde los integrantes son solidarios, “como una familia”, afirma. Estrella, invertirá el dinero en la compra de carne de cerdo, que le sirve como insumo para su chicharronería.
texts.en:
Estrella, 53, is an unassuming woman.  She lives with her two children: Wilfredo and Yamileth who she cares for in the house she bought ten years ago.  Her economic activity for the last 20 years has been meat sales.  She relates that her work consists in buying pigs in quantity especially the heaviest and healthiest ones.  Once she acquires them, she butchers them to sell the meat in regional and district markets.  She earns good profits and also takes advantage of the stand she has to also sell beauty products to customers that know her.  She does very well with the business.  “I sell more meat during festivals,” she affirms.  She recently painted the space she will use to open her ‘chicharronería’ (a place where pork-based dishes are sold) to earn more profits because she’ll get the pork and will use it herself to prepare the dishes.  She already started working and is doing very well since she’s located in a commercial zone.

She’s a member of the “IDME” communal bank and this is MFP loan #27.  In all these years, she’s been able to improve her business because she used her money very intelligently.  On the other hand, she once again promises to make her installment payments.  Also, it pleases her to be part of her association where all the members are mutually supportive, “like a family,” she affirms.  Estrella will use the money to buy pork which will be an ingredient for her chicharronería.

loans.use: to buy pork.

loans.name: Dania Olandina

texts.es:
La señora Dania tiene 32 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive con su esposo  y sus  2 hijos  en una comunidad de Choluteca al sur de Honduras. 
Doña Dania se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y necesita el préstamo para la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisas, calzonetas, gorras, faldas, vestidos, calcetines, suéteres, ropa interior y sandalias.
Doña Dania espera que sus ventas aumenten en esta temporada navideña y con el préstamo brindado  tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y poder cubrir los pedidos que le hacen.
Doña Dania espera que su situación  económica mejore un poco para poder ayudar a su familia. En unos años ella espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el más grande y reconocido de la zona y a su vez que su familia viva de una manera digna y sin preocupaciones.
texts.en:
Dane is 32 years old, honest responsible and honest. She lives with her husband and two children the community of Choluteca, in the south of Honduras.  She works in the sale of new clothing and needs a loan to purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, underwear, hats, skirts, dresses, socks, sweaters, and sandals. 

Dania is expecting her sales to boost during the Christmas season and with this loan she hopes to be able to offer more product to her customers and be able to fill the order that she has. 

Dania expects her financial situation to improve so hat she can help her family. She expects her business to grown in the following years, and become the largest and better known business of the area and that her family is able to live with a decent standard of living and no worries.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, underwear, hats, skirts, dresses, socks, sweaters, and sandals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for his recordings.
